Description:
About the job
Job Title: Business Analyst (Data & Business Intelligence)
Job Location: India (Remote)
Job Overview: 
Business Analyst is responsible for providing functional analytic expertise to Caidya team members, serving as a key customer-facing resource to the organization. Collaborate with all Caidya cross-functional teams to support the growth and continuous evolution of our enterprise business intelligence (BI) solutions. The role will identify, analyze, implement, coordinate, and prioritize project tasks, and communicate with IT team members, Caidya cross functional teams, and external vendors. The Business Analyst will ensure each project is implemented within contractual obligations, internal SOPs, and regulatory requirements. 
This position will report to the Senior Director, Data & Business Intelligence 
 Job Duties and Responsibilities:
Requirements Assessment and Gathering
· Discuss, define, analyze, and produce written Business Requirements and/or User Stories so that they can be easily understood. This will include scenarios whereby the requirements are at diverse levels of maturity. A hands-on approach is required in this area. 
· Both functional and non-functional requirements will need to be documented, ensuring alignment with organizational strategic goals.
· Knowledge of traditional Software Development Life Cycles (SDLC) and Agile lifecycle methodologies with experience capturing requirements in both environments. 
Influencing Business Change
· Act as a bridge between various stakeholders across all business units and technology levels throughout the organization, playing a crucial role in ensuring the desired change is successful. 
· Facilitate workshops as required across stakeholders at all levels to ensure successful implementation, training, adoption, and a culture of collaboration. 
· Develop and deliver end-user training and establish and maintain user reference materials for all user types for assigned projects/products. 
· Evaluate solution effectiveness through interpretation and analysis of key metrics, translating data into actionable insights.
Problem Solutioning
· Active participation and guidance of the team is necessary to work through issues and drive the team to an agreed-upon solution. 
· The Business Analyst will utilize business and user insights to form solutions ideas and make prioritization decisions to maximize the value of the IT solutions. The role requires an individual with the mindset that problems can be solved. 
Project Support
· Work closely with the business owners of the application/solution, being the intermediary between them and BI development staff in all phases of the analysis processes. 
· Ensure that Technology teammates understand the business requirements in detail by translating requirements into technical terms. 
· Support Technology peers throughout the project/product lifecycle from analysis to implementation, including project intake, analysis, backlog grooming, documentation, QA (Quality Assurance), change management, implementation, user support, etc. 
· Support business to define the User Acceptance Test criteria, help business in defining User Acceptance test scenarios. 
· Learn about every business system that contributes to the BI portfolio and how to navigate and evaluate analytics solutions effectively.
 Supervisory Responsibilities:
None
Job Requirements:
· Education
o 4-year college degree in a related field; Management of Information Systems (MIS) or Computer Science.
· Experience
o 1-3 years’ experience in business analysis and managing multiple data and analytic projects required. 
o Previous experience in KPIs definition and storytelling visual analytics, preferably Power BI.
o Strong analytical, oral, and written communication abilities, relationship management, consulting skills, as well as proficiency with technology required. 
o Ability to navigate within a fast-paced, rapidly maturing environment. 
o Highly proficient technical writing capabilities. 
o A team player who demonstrates strengths of integrity, accountability, ownership, and analytical thinking. 
o Excellent organizational and time-management skills, with significant experience managing multiple workstreams and cross-functional teams; formal project management experience.
o Experience with both agile and waterfall project management approaches. 
· Skills/Competencies
o Strong written and verbal communication skills
o Strong interpersonal skills and a team player
o Able to exercise judgment within defined procedures and practices and to determine appropriate action independently.
o Exceptional attention to detail
o Superior problem-solving skills
 · Capabilities
o Ability to learn new technologies / processes.
o Ability to perform a variety of tasks.
o Ability to problem-solve.
o Ability to take direction from other IT staff.
o Ability to work independently.
o Ability to work remotely.

Description:
About the job
Join a team that is changing millions of lives.

Transforming smiles, changing lives.

 

At Align Technology, we believe a great smile can transform a person’s life, so we create technology that gives people the confidence to take on whatever’s next. We revolutionized the orthodontic industry with the introduction of the Invisalign system, and we have never lost sight of that spirit of innovation. Our diverse and collaborative teams are constantly pushing the boundaries of what’s possible.

 

Ready to join us?

About This Opportunity

The Analyst will be responsible for providing analytic support for the AMS Sales/Marketing team. This position will provide accurate and timely reports as well as proactive insights and recommendations to help drive Align Technologies business.

In this role, you will…

Analyse data from all dimensions and share valuable insights with good data story telling and presentation skills. 
Support data-driven decision making within organization.
Formulate Target with 
Direct experience with experimentation design and A/B test measurement
Connect to stakeholders to ideate, validate, and build analytical solution.
Search and create datasets to support analytical solution.
Develop and implement key performance metrics that help identify business opportunities and measure Sales and Marketing operations performance.
Participate in quarterly close process and preparation of reporting package for sales and marketing.
Need to work from office 3 days a week (Tue to Thu) and rest working days from remote location.
Provide ad hoc reporting and analysis for assigned departments on an as needed basis. 

In this role, you’ll need …

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience. 
5-6 Years experience in Analytics Project.
2-3 relevant experience to plan independently and execute repeatable data analyses recommend actionable strategy for a variety of industries.
Having portfolio on Kaggle, Git hub and competitions is value add.
Worked on descriptive statistics, time series, regression, clustering and classification problems.
Ability to work alone and directly with business partners.
Detail oriented with focus on quality and accuracy.
Strong verbal and written communication skills; ability to develop and maintain business relationships with various team members across the organization. Strong cross-functional skills with IT/BI teams required. 
Proven track record of working effectively in a collaborative, fast-paced, multi-tasking environment.
Ability to work with some or minimal direction and supervision. 
Bachelor’s degree in business or analytical field is preferred.
Strong database query and data manipulation skills are required (SQL, MS Excel, etc...)

Sound like a good fit?  

Great! Click the "Apply" link to let us know you are interested. Not the right fit? Don’t worry, Align is quickly growing so we are creating more opportunities to expand our Align family. Please consider joining our Talent Network to receive notifications about future jobs or sharing this opportunity with others in your network. 

 

About Align 

Align Technology is a publicly traded medical device company that is transforming smiles and changing lives. Our global team of talented employees develop innovative technology, tools and treatment options to help dental professionals worldwide achieve the clinical results they expect. Our digital ecosystem combines the power of technology to create beautiful smiles through the integration of AI and machine learning, digital imaging and visualization, biomechanics and material science to develop the Invisalign system, the most advanced clear aligner system in the world; iTero Intraoral Scanners and OrthoCAD digital services. Did you know? Align is the world’s largest manufacturer of custom 3D-printed materials. 

 

By joining Align, you will be part of a global, fast-growing company in one of the most dynamic industries. Great people, innovative technologies, and meaningful work – these are just some of the things employees say make Align Technology a great place to work. 

 

We respect your privacy. Please review our Applicant Privacy Policies for additional information. 

 

Global Diversity Statement

At Align, we believe in the power of a smile, and we know that every smile is as unique as our employees. As we grow, we will continue building a workforce of diverse cultural backgrounds and life experiences and fostering a culture of open-mindedness and compassion for all our employees. We live our company values by promoting healthy people and healthy communities. All with the intent of changing millions of lives, one unique smile at a time.

Equal Opportunity Statement

It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunity in all of our employment practices without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, marital status, protected veteran status, age, individuals with disabilities, sexual orientation or gender identity or expression or any other legally protected category. Applicants for positions with Align must be legally authorized to work in the country which they are applying for and verification of employment eligibility will be required as a condition of hire.

Title: Data Analyst
Company: Vestas · Chennai, Tamil Nadu, India · 2 weeks ago
Experience Level:
Full-time
Matches your job preferences, job type is Full-time.
Description:
About the job
Vestas is the world leader in wind technology and a Defining-force in the development of the wind power industry. Vestas' core business comprises the development, manufacture, sale, marketing, and maintenance of Wind Turbines. Come and Join us at Vestas!

Digital Solutions > Digital Architecture, Data & AI > Data & AI

The Data Product and Insights is part of Data & AI-Digital Solutions, the data and AI COE for the E2E value chain at Vestas. This team is responsible for creating data products using the latest technology, that create value by solving business requirements or challenges in coordination with Product Owners, also part of the same organization. The data products are crucial for multiple verticals at the company, as +10k people organization that relies on these data insights for data-driven decision-making and performance management. Examples of the functions that benefit from the data insights are Service Operations, Supply Chain, Commercial or Quality; and they consume this information to create tangible improvements around cost performance, build asset production performance, and overall business optimization by creating more transparency and a data driven culture.

Responsibilities

Enable a data driven organization through data analytics deployed via self-service tools, to make better decisions based on insights from data, to improve operational performance
Create new insights through programming and integration of new data sources deployed in BI tools to improve transparency and enable better choice
Develop and Deliver analytical dashboards for internal stakeholders levering Enterprise Platforms
Continuous improvement of existing dashboards through own initiative and stakeholder feedback
Support on-going initiatives involving statistical modeling and programming
Support with developing and tracking key business & operational performance indicators
Develop recommendation for how to enrich the existing product suite

Qualifications

Background in Engineering / Applied Statistics at Bachelors (Degree in Computer Science, IT, Business Science, Engineering or similar)
Relevant experience in data analytics, business intelligence & advanced SQL programming
Previous experience from exposure to multi-cultural and international organizations
5+ years of working experience as a Data Analyst

Competencies

Enterprise working experience in business intelligence/analytics teams in design, development, and maintenance of BI & Data Analytics solutions
Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases (RDBMS, Datawarehouse, Datalake)
Strong foundation in Visual design, Storytelling and Descriptive Analytics to build BI dashboards that are visually compelling, scalable and efficient solutions
Working experience in enterprise Microsoft Power BI in building Apps, Dashboards and reports is mandatory
Hands-on working experience in SSAS/Azure Analysis services to build tabular models is mandatory
Solid hands-on working experience in RDBMS querying languages like MS-SQL is mandatory
Experience/working knowledge in Azure ecosystem (Azure Data Lake Storage, Synapse Analytics) or Snowflake is recommended
Working knowledge in Python/R Programming would be an added advantage

What We Offer

We offer an opportunity to work alongside some of the brightest minds at Vestas, an opportunity to learn and grow.

BEWARE – RECRUITMENT FRAUD

It has come to our attention that there are a number of fraudulent emails from people pretending to work for Vestas. Read more via this link, www.vestas.com/en/careers/job-openings

About Vestas

Vestas is the energy industry’s global partner on sustainable energy solutions. We are specialised in designing, manufacturing, installing, and servicing wind turbines, both onshore and offshore.

Across the globe, we have installed more wind power than anyone else. We consider ourselves pioneers within the industry, as we continuously aim to design new solutions and technologies to create a more sustainable future for all of us. With more than 173 GW of wind power installed worldwide and 40+ years of experience in wind energy, we have an unmatched track record demonstrating our expertise within the field.

With 29,000 employees globally, we are a diverse team united by a common goal: to power the solution – today, tomorrow, and far into the future.

Vestas promotes a diverse workforce which embraces all social identities and is free of any discrimination. We commit to create and sustain an environment that acknowledges and harvests different experiences, skills, and perspectives. We also aim to give everyone equal access to opportunity.

To learn more about our company and life at Vestas, we invite you to visit our website at www.vestas.com and follow us on our social media channels. We also encourage you to join our Talent Universe to receive notifications on new and relevant postings.

Company: Juno · Bengaluru, Karnataka, India · 2 weeks ago
Experience Level:
On-site

Description:
About the job
Juno offers a cash account that enables users to buy and sell crypto with ease. We process $1.5 billion in transactions yearly, ranking among the top 5 US banking apps. So far, we have raised $23 million across seed and Series A from top investors like Sequoia, Polychain, Dragonfly, and Jump, among others. The platform is designed to enhance the financial experience for individuals who want to do more with their checking accounts.

We are looking for a Data Analyst - Intern to help in transforming raw data into meaningful insights and actionable recommendations. Your responsibilities will revolve around collecting, processing, analysing, and interpreting data to provide valuable observations and support data-driven decision-making within an organisation.

Responsibilities

Gathering data from various sources, which may include databases, spreadsheets, APIs, and other data repositories
Ensuring data accuracy and consistency by cleaning, validating, and organising data for analysis
Design and develop complex data queries to move and transform data from operational data sources to analytical databasesBuild informative and user-friendly dashboards to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and track business metrics, allowing stakeholders to have a real-time view of the company's performance
Participate in the Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) process, ensuring data from different sources is cleansed, transformed, and loaded into Amazon Redshift for analysis
Work with data engineers and architects to design data models within Amazon Redshift, enabling efficient querying and reporting
Use Metabase, Tableau, and/or Power BI to explore and analyse data from various sources, including Amazon Redshift, databases, and other data warehouses
Build interactive and visually appealing dashboards and reports using Metabase, Tableau, and/or Power BI to present data insights to stakeholders


Requirements

Pursuing a bachelor's/master's degree (passing out in 2024 or earlier) in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, or a related field. Advanced degrees are a plus
Proven experience as a data intern, with specific experience working with Amazon Redshift or other cloud-based data warehousing platforms
Strong proficiency in SQL for data extraction and analysis - Familiarity with data visualisation tools like Metabase, Tableau, Power BI

Description:
About the job
Job Title: Data Analyst - Business Intelligence 
 Are you passionate about data, generating actionable insights from data and work in a team that helps business take accelerated decision, gain valuable insights based on data, visual data exploration and AI driven insights? With over 26 million customers trusting us with their life savings, each with different goals, you’ll have the opportunity to work on a myriad of high-impact use cases. We also enable in reducing the time between data coming into our complex and having real insights for the business, to a minimum. The future of analytics is now, and we want you to join us as we help create an ecosystem of real-time analytics, self-service analytics dashboards and a personalized customer experience. 
 The Purpose of Your Role 
Fidelity is looking for an accomplished data analytics professional, Creative and Collaborative team player, helping develop and modernize the Sensors platform within the Personal Investing (PI) division of Fidelity. This work provides a platform to see the progress of Domain/Tribe/Team level KPIs against the set target as we progress through the year. You’ll be part of a talented individual contributors with a diverse set of skills across analytics, data engineering and machine learning - partnering together to take the BI (Sensors) platform to the next level. 
 The Expertise we’re looking for 
Engineering or Master degree - Computer Science or Mathematics/Statistics. 
4+ years of relevant experience. 
Work Experience with data visualization tool - Tableau (on Cloud/AWS). 
Proficiency with database querying tool - SQL (Snowflake) and programming - Python. 
Knowledge in AWS Concepts, Data Warehousing, Data Modelling and exposure to OLAP. 
Knowledge/Experience in At-Scale, Power BI, Tableau (AWS) Administration would be a plus. 
Excellent written, oral communication and presentation skills - ability to present complex data, research findings in a simple, clear and actionable way. 
Demonstrated track record of customer-focused engagement and collaboration is required. 
 The Skills You Bring 
You bring passion to your work and operate with a sense of purpose that inspires and motivates those you work with. 
You are intellectually curious, always eager to learn new skills and share the knowledge with others. 
You bring a data-driven approach to decision making. 
You demonstrate a mix of analytics and technical skills - SQL, any programming language and/or Data Visualization tools. 
You have extensive experience in partnering with key stakeholders to understand their business needs and delivering self-service solutions to exceed their expectations. 
 The Value You Deliver 
You enable the squad to consistently enhance data, business/domain skills and technical skills. 
As a continuous learner, you’ll stay abreast of the latest innovations across analytics, data science and machine learning, proactively developing your analytical skills to maintain your world-class expertise. 
Working across Fidelity, you will determine and help shape analytic needs and capabilities to meet the needs for our customers along with your fellow analysts and product owners. 
You drive continuous improvement in business process automation and self-service dashboard. 
 How Your work Impacts the Organization 
 Fidelity places a strong emphasis on making data-driven decisions to drive growth and profitability. You will play a critical role in building the analytic tools and capabilities that drive the organization’s strategic business decisions.

Description:
About the job
Company Overview

Targray - Building sustainable solutions for a world in transition.

Established in 1987 in Montreal, Canada, Targray is a global leader in the sourcing, transportation, storage, trading and distribution of commodities and advanced materials for a broad range of industry sectors. Our supply solutions help reduce the world's carbon footprint while enabling our customers to create safer, more reliable products for consumers.

Targray has operations in 11 countries and over $1B USD in annual sales. In 2019, the company made its debut appearance on the FP500, Financial Post’s ranking of the top 500 corporations in Canada by revenue.

Great Place to Work® | Best Workplaces in Quebec (2020, 2021)
Deloitte | Best Managed Companies (2019 - 2022)
EY Canada | Quebec Entrepreneur of the Year (2016)
HSBC | International Business Award (2012)
Profit 100 Fastest-Growing Companies in Canada (2006, 2009)

Job Summary

As a part of our continued expansion in its technology organization, Targray is seeking to hire a Data Analyst, to join our Risk and Data Technology Team based at our India Office Gurgaon, Haryana.

Responsibilities

Using automated tools to extract data from primary and secondary sources including MS SQL databases, CSV, flat files, XML, Excels
Removing corrupted data, normalization, regularization and fixing coding errors and related problems
Performing analysis to assess quality and meaning of data and extracting value from data
Filter Data by reviewing reports and performance indicators to identify and correct code problems
Develop data access, extraction, integration, and processing for applications including valuing trades/transactions using technologies like MS SQL, Python
Preparing final analysis reports for the stakeholders to understand the data-analysis steps, enabling them to take important decisions based on various facts and trends
The incumbent will work closely with other IS and Targray staff in problem resolution and will search for means to reduce common errors

Requirements

University degree (B.Tech./MCA) in computer science or computer application. 
Minimum 3+ years proven experience in software development, and business analytics
Should be conversant with any industry standard ETL & reporting tool (Power BI preferable)
Strong mathematical skills to help collect, measure, organize and analyze data
Knowledge of programming languages like SQL, MySQL and Python
Knowledge on MS SQL queries, functions, procedures, triggers would be an added advantage
Technical proficiency regarding database design development, data models, techniques for data mining, and segmentation
Knowledge of how to create and apply the most accurate algorithms to datasets to find solutions
Knowledge and hand on Experience on Python Packages such as Data Structures, Pandas, NumPy, SQL Alchemy, Selenium etc
Sound analytical and problem-solving skills
Verbal and Written communication skills
Proven working experience in data analysis
Adhere to timelines and quality of the assigned task
Ability to work under pressure on multiple assignments
Must have excellent English oral and written communications skills
Must have the ability and desire to thrive in a fast-paced, service-oriented environment

Benefits

A competitive remuneration plan and an excellent working environment in a growing multinational organization
Beautiful, spacious, and modern workplace environment
Flexible work arrangement policy
Generous company-wide profit-sharing plan
Off-site Team Building and experiential development
Life Insurance and Accidental Insurance for Self
Free Medical Insurance for Self and Family
Weekly Team Lunches
Gym Benefits
Corporate Team Fun Activities

Diversity & Inclusion

Diversity and inclusiveness are at the heart of who we are and how we work. We are committed to fostering an environment where differences are valued, policies and practices are equitable, and our people feel a sense of belonging. We welcome and embrace the diverse experiences, abilities, backgrounds, and perspectives that make our people unique and help guide us. When people feel free to be their authentic selves at work, they bring their best and are empowered to build a better working world.

For more information about our company, please visit https://www.targray.com/..

About the job
Job Description

Job Purpose

Data Analyst, Market Data will join the Master Data Management team within Intercontinental Exchange (ICE). The Master Data Management Operations team is responsible for building and maintaining corporate company-wide data uniformity. This position will be responsible for managing high-level data sets (Business Entity, Client Segmentation, Contact Data etc.) and onboarding new acquisitions on schedule. The successful candidate will work on new and existing projects in close collaboration with teams that include Data Warehouse, Sales, Finance, and internal stakeholders.

The analyst must be results-oriented, self-motivated and have the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment. The candidate must have the ability to work independently; must have excellent verbal and written communication skills; must have excellent organizational skills.

Responsibilities

Candidates are responsible for analyzing various levels of client specific information and to ensure that it is populated into the database of record in an accurate, complete, and timely manner.
Clearly and concisely document requirements for each project being undertaken.
Assist in evaluating information gathered from multiple sources, reconciling conflicts, and determining best path forward.
Performs changes to master data following established processes including but not limited to create, change, activate/deactivate or otherwise modify master data.
Identifies areas for data quality improvements and helps to resolve data quality problems through the appropriate procedures or improvements.
Utilize Salesforce, OBIEE, and Capital IQ to reconcile data outputs.
Work closely with other team members and cross-functional team members.

Knowledge And Experience

3 - 5 Years of Experience in Secondary research which involves summary, collation, and synthesis of existing research.
Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Advanced experience in Excel and database technologies including pivot tables, Visual Basic/SQL query writing.
Excellent communication skills. Position must communicate clearly, respectfully, and effectively with many different types of people and departments across the firm.
Strong knowledge and understanding of the Financial Markets Data.
Strong Analytical and problem-solving skills.
Exceptional organizational skills and ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities.
Excellent attention to detail and high degree of demonstrated decision-making and problem-solving skills.
Must possess the ability to influence others.
Ability to distill large amounts of varied information into specific takeaways.
Post graduate degree (preferably MBA Finance) or Bachelor's degree with equivalent combination of education and experience.

Schedule

This role offers work from home flexibility of up to 2 days per week.

About the job

What this job involves?

Shaping the future of real estate for a better world

At JLL, we see a Brighter Way forward for our clients, our people, our planet, and our communities. With over 200 years of real estate experience, we are, and always have been, in continual pursuit of brighter ways of working.

We bring to life see a Brighter Way in all that we do by seeking better, smarter, more innovative ways of working. We approach our work in a warmer, more optimistic, and inclusive way.

JLL is a global leader in helping clients envision where people will live, work, play, shop, and eat.

What This Opportunity Involves

We seek a Junior Sustainability Data Analyst to join our team. You will support the sustainability data analyst reporting, data management, platform, compliance and reporting functions for a wide range of assets across JLL.

JLL's purpose-driven global sustainability program delivers impact on climate action for sustainable real estate, healthy spaces for all people and thriving communities.

We are a rapidly expanding team, and over time we continuously support your growth with development opportunities available within our data and analytics teams.

An Overview Of The Role

Assist the reporting team with insights, analytics, preparing data and presentations.
Assist the team with delivering projects that will enable clients to meet sustainability reporting objectives.
Develop a detailed understanding of JLL's sustainability reporting application and how we support clients in measuring sustainability performance.
Assist the team with client delivery milestones to ensure they are being met.

Sounds like you? This is what we are looking for

A passion for Sustainability and pulling together associated Data and Reporting.
Intermediate Excel skills.
Insights, element visualisation, and presenting data.
Excellent communication skills.

What You Can Expect From Us

You'll join an entrepreneurial, inclusive culture. One where the best inspire the best. Where like-minded people work naturally together to achieve great things. Join us to develop your strengths and enjoy a fulfilling career full of varied experiences. Keep those ambitions in sight and imagine where JLL can take you.

As an organisation, we don't just accept that we are a place of many different people, but we embrace it, we celebrate it, and we proactively support the needs that difference brings. JLL is committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, gender, age, sexual orientation or disability, and that is why, for more than a decade, we continue to rank among the World's Most Ethical Companies.

We are dedicated to offering veterans from all ranks and services a successful civilian career as they transition out of the military. We recognise and appreciate the skills acquired in their service careers as vital and transferable to our workforce.

On-site -Bengaluru, KA

About Polaris:

As the global leader in powersports, Polaris Inc. (NYSE: PII) pioneers product breakthroughs and enriching experiences and services that have invited people to discover the joy of being outdoors since our founding in 1954. Polaris' high- quality product line-up includes the Polaris RANGER, RZR and GENERAL side-by-side off-road vehicles; Sportsman all- terrain off-road vehicles; Indian Motorcycle mid-size and heavyweight motorcycles; Slingshot moto-roadsters; snowmobiles; and deck, cruiser, and pontoon boats, including industry-leading Bennington pontoons. Polaris enhances the riding experience with parts, garments, and accessories, along with a growing aftermarket portfolio. Polaris' presence in adjacent markets includes military and commercial off-road vehicles, quadricycles, and electric vehicles. Company is headquartered in Minnesota, USA, Polaris serves more than 100 countries across the globe. www.polaris.com

Polaris offers you an opportunity to come on board and make a difference. We offer a competitive salary and a comprehensive relocation package. To round it off, a benefits package that allows you to work hard and play harder.

Polaris is an Equal Opportunity Employer and will make all employment-related decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, familial status, status about public assistance, membership, or activity in a local commission, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by applicable law.

The Polaris Data & Analytics Organization works with business leaders and analysts across the enterprise to drive optimized strategy using data. The Sr. Data Analyst is responsible for developing analytics products and enabling the broader organization of data-focused professionals to efficiently consume analytical solutions. You are an advocate for analytics adoption, creative problem solver, and a key strategic partner to the business.

 Day to day interaction with international stakeholders to understand the business problem –prior business facing experience will be helpful for this role.
 Innovate and design analytics strategies to solve the business problems.
 Develop Analytics Products using SQL/SnowFlake, PowerBI, Alteryx.

QUALIFICATIONS:

 3+ years of work experience in an analytics-focused role.
 Experience with data preparation, visualization, and processing from a diverse set of data sources.
 Highly proficient with data mining/visualization/data modeling tools: SQL/Snowflake, Power BI and Business facing experience. 

4. Knowledge of Alteryx is a plus.

 Strong knowledge of data engineering principles and best practices.
 Experience performing root cause analysis and troubleshooting technical issues.
 Naturally curious and creative problem solver with experience working in an agile environment.
 Advanced knowledge of data manipulation using excel, including reporting.
 Intermediate knowledge of statistical methods and predictive/analytical modeling techniques and practices.
 Intermediate knowledge of Python programming language.

We are an ambitious, resourceful, and driven workforce, which empowers us to THINK OUTSIDE. Apply today!

On-site

Mid-Senior level
Description:
About the job
Who We Are:

Esko is a part of Veralto’s Product Quality & Innovation companies. Esko is a global provider of integrated software and hardware solutions that accelerate the go-to-market process of packaged goods. Our products empower teams to support and manage the packaging design and print processes for brand owners, retailers, pre-media and trade shops, manufacturers, and converters.

Veralto is a global leader in essential technology solutions with annual revenue of nearly $5 billion and a proven track record of solving some of the most complex challenges we face as a society. Our industry-leading companies and globally recognized brands are building on a long-established legacy of innovation and customer trust to create a safer, cleaner, more vibrant future. Veralto is headquartered in Waltham, Mass. with 13 operating companies and 300+ locations worldwide. Our global team of 16,000 associates is committed to making an enduring positive impact on the world and is united by a powerful purpose: Safeguarding the World’s Most Vital Resources™.

Imagine a world where everyone has access to clean water, safe food and medicine, and trusted essential goods. That is the tomorrow Veralto (VLTO) is creating today.

Veralto’s Product Quality & Innovation companies—Esko, Linx, Pantone, Videojet, and X-Rite—help package and protect the world’s food, medicine, and essentials, tracing and authenticating billions of goods that travel the global supply chain every day.

Veralto’s Water Quality companies—Aquatic Informatics, ChemTreat, Hach, McCrometer, OTT HydroMet, Sea-Bird Scientific, Trojan Technologies and XOS—help manage, treat, purify, and protect the global water supply, from municipal and industrial wastewater treatment facilities to lakes, rivers, watersheds, and oceans.

Main role / Job Objective:

The BI Business Analyst embodies the interaction between business & the BI team, supports the transformation to a data-driven organisation, operates on a global basis and frequently interacts with business stakeholders globally on the one hand and with BI development resources on the other hand.

Main responsibilities and key activities:

You spend time with business to understand and document business processes. 
You identify in the various system databases which tables and fields are used to store the data during these business processes, and which transformations are done along the way. 
You gather business requirements to determine what measures, visuals, trends, etc. business users want to see in the various Power BI reports. 
You work with business to prepare data glossaries. 
You work with business to define how measures need to be calculated. 
You translate business requirements into functional requirements for the BI development team, and work with the BI developers to design extensions to the BI data lakehouse. 
You test and validate the quality of the implementation. 
You work with business to facilitate User Acceptance Testing. 
You troubleshoot questions/problems from the user community, searching for the root cause and designing long-term solution(s). 


Positioning:

From whom do you receive direction: Manager Business Intelligence & Analytics (located in Ghent, Belgium) 
You will be part of the BI team (partially located in Belgium, partially located in India), consisting of BI data engineers, BI data/business analysts and the manager BI & Analytics


Qualifications and professional knowledge:

= The technical or specific knowledge required to perform the job successfully (e.g. diploma and/or level of education required for the job, languages, programming languages, duration of experience …)

You have a bachelor’s degree in economics, computer science, engineering, mathematics or related field of study. Master’s degree preferred. 
You have strong knowledge in business processes and how to document these. 
You have minimum 6 years’ experience in a data/business analysis role in a BI environment. 
Advanced knowledge of SQL and Python 
You can communicate ideas clearly and effectively both in speaking and writing. 
You have influencing skills which gives you the ability to establish and maintain effective business relationships with business units and other associates. 
You have eye for detail and are interested in understanding how our business works. 
You are fluent in English, both written & spoken. 
Proactive attitude, i.e., ‘avoid’ rather than ‘react’. 


What We Value

We believe that real breakthroughs come from teams that think big and respect each other’s differences – different ideas, different perspectives, and different experiences. We encourage all voices to be heard, both internally as we collaborate and externally as we listen to our customers’ most pressing needs. And we would love to have you on this journey with us! Apply today.

Our Culture

More important than what we do is how we operate together as a team across our global organization. Each of our businesses has a unique local culture which is inspired by variety of perspectives our diverse team members bring to the table. However, Veralto and all our businesses share the same foundation comprised of our values and passion for continuous improvement through the Veralto Enterprise System that enables our teams to bring our unifying purpose to life around the world.

Our Values

We serve humanity with purpose and integrity
We unlock ingenuity for customer success
We deliver results as a team
We continually improve for enduring impact


Our offer 

We grow talent; we give you the opportunity to develop your career based on your strengths. ESKO is a career destination for engaged passionate and talented people who are driven to seek innovation, growth and opportunity.
A career with ESKO will push you and challenge you, providing growth opportunities and the
prospects to advance your career.
If you are a driven high achiever, you will work with committed, like-minded people, giving you the
support to reach your full potential.
At Veralto, your potential is amplified. Our culture of continuous improvement defines who we are, drives our success, and translates to a career without limits for our team of curious associates.


Equal Opportunity:

Veralto Corporation and all Veralto Companies are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, national origin, religion, sex, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other characteristics protected by law. We value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.

At Veralto, we value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.

Description:
About the job
This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.  

About the Role: Grade Level (for internal use): 07 S&P Global Market Intelligence The Role: Data Analyst The Locations: Gurugram/Hyderabad/Ahmedabad The Team: The Team of Data Analystss work on various research reports and company documents to collect information & generate meaningful consensus from the collected data. This effort is coupled with real-time monitoring of global industry trade publications and websites/news aggregators. Different Team supports the below & many more business lines: Market Data & Estimates – The team provides the highest quality content of Consensus Estimates, Actuals, and Guidance information that is essential for our clients to make decisions with conviction. The team works on various research reports and company documents and collect information for forecasted and actual numbers and generate meaningful consensus from collected data. Translations Team: Translations team delivers and maintains accurate, complete, and timely data sets by utilizing internal & external public research sources such as government & regulatory documents, stock exchanges, industry journals, analyst reports, as well as information databases. The data thus collected/processed plays a crucial role in further analysis and overall client experience. F&S Team : Filing & Sourcing team works like a data factory to source documents to market intelligence teams. The team creates value to internal stakeholders by sourcing financial and non-financial data. We are looking for people who are passionate about research and would like to contribute by utilizing internal & external public research sources. You will be part of most trending and growing team. Alongside you will gain valuable insights. You will deliver and maintain accurate, complete, and timely data sets while taking into account the business global interests and needs internally & externally. Fundamentals (Industry, General Fundamentals & Compustat): The team delivers and maintains accurate, complete, and timely data sets while taking into account the business units’ global interests and needs internally & externally. Fundamentals Data is part of the Data/Content Management Group. The team is involved in various processes, carrying out tasks involving data collection, standardizing, database maintenance, correction of the data, and publishing. Transactions (M&A), Public Ownership & Private Equity - The Private Equity and Advisory Profiles Team primarily focuses on maintaining and updating profiles of Private Equity and Venture Capital firms. With global coverage, we aim to deliver research, content, and analytics about the public and private capital markets to investment banks, investment managers and alternative investment firms. The team also establishes relationships with Private Equity Firms to gather rare insights about public & private investments, exits, and investment strategies. This effort is coupled with our real time monitoring of global industry trade publications and websites/news aggregators to cover and track all public/private investment markets. Corporate & Reference Data: The Corporate & Reference Data works as a backbone of the S&P Global databases which maintains & delivers all the Entity level data for S&P Global products involving research centric data collection for profile information, entity & security level symbol linking, people data, corporate structure. Reference data integrates, maintains, manages, and delivers Cross Reference Identifiers at Entity and Security level. The Corporate Data focuses on maintaining and updating profiles of company and professional level data for private and public companies with Research firms globally including profiling information like Industry classification, descriptions, headquarter addresses along with business relationship & professionals. The team also maintains Corporate Structure information for public & private companies globally. Our data enables corporations, institutions and investors to make informed business decisions. Key Devs & Events: Key Developments & Events team covers any significant news which could potentially impact the company's share price, corporate actions for future date, events coverage for publicly traded companies globally. Transforms raw data into usable intelligence and provides data for making decisions with conviction. Operates from Ahmadabad, Hyderabad and Islamabad locations and works 24/6 to deliver data in timely fashion. Team sifts through press releases/articles, regulatory filings and company websites coupled with extensive data research for qualitative product. The Impact: We provide the highest quality content that is essential for our clients to make decisions with conviction. As a Data Analyst, you will support the integrity and comprehensiveness of the data set by utilizing internal & external public research sources such as government & regulatory documents, stock exchanges, industry journals, analyst reports and our internal research tools to collect, summarize, and synthesize relevant information. What’s in it for you: With exciting learning opportunities at its core, we'll help you focus on building the essential skills needed for a successful and meaningful transition into the professional world. This position is an excellent stepping stone to understanding the global market dynamism, which will allow you to gain a comprehensive understanding of the market and enable you to learn the various facets of the assigned industry. Title: Data Analyst Intern
Company: Jar · Bengaluru, Karnataka, India · 3 weeks ago
Experience Level:
On-site
Matches your job preferences, workplace type is On-site.
Internship
Matches your job preferences, job type is Internship.
Description:
About the job
We are seeking a talented Data Analyst enthusiast to join The Jar Team. If you are intellectually curious, if you eat/sleep/drink data and are committed to translating data to insights & insights to actionable work items, want new challenges daily and impact the lives of hundreds of thousands of users, this is the role for you!

What is Jar?

The Jar app is a habit-building micro-savings platform that helps users save fixed amounts from as little as ₹10, and our revolutionary round-off method effortlessly accumulates spare change from digital transactions and invests it in digital gold.

Founded by Nishchay AG, former director, and founding member at mobility start-up Bounce, and Misbah Ashraf, founder of community-focused e-commerce platform Marsplay, Jar's unwavering mission is to shatter psychological barriers to saving and investing, thus spearheading the Financial Fitness revolution for Bharat.

What does Jar do?

With seamless ease of use, we provide users the ability to withdraw their savings directly to their bank accounts as cash or receive physical gold, which is delivered right to their doorstep. Furthermore, Jar empowers individuals with a flexible line of credit, starting at ₹1000, offering instant access to funds when needed.

Responsibilities

Developing analysis and reporting capabilities. Assigning a numerical value to essential business functions so that business performance can be assessed and compared over periods of time
Monitoring performance and quality to identify improvements. Optimize existing services and systems, and ensure data quality and source of truth availability
Collaborating with other teams to find useful business insights
Supporting other teams in setting up success metrics for particular products/features
Working closely with the Project Manager to deliver on business requirements OTIF (ontime in full)
Working with both Web Analytics and Backend Data analytics
Quickly learning and using Bespoke & third party SaaS reporting tools with little documentation
Assisting in presenting demos and preparing materials for leadership


Requirements

Experience with Python Data Analysis Packages(Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib, Scikit-Learn) is a must
Data Exploration and Visualisation with tools like Amplitude, Clevertap, MS Excel, Tableau, Power BI, etc
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organise, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Adept at queries, report writing, and presenting findings
A strong business sense with the ability to transform ambiguous business and product issues into well-scoped, impactful analysis
A desire to work in a fast-paced environment
Proactive communication


Why join Jar, you ask?

Jar is a diverse and inclusive workplace which embraces ideas and perspectives of all employees, and recognises their efforts and contributions regardless of gender or ethnicity. Our workspace also boasts a great blend of youth and experience, which helps us maintain a transparent culture with no micromanagement. We also have flexible working hours, and provide medical insurance to all employees.

About the job
Job Title: Data Operations Analyst
Location: Mumbai

Kantar Worldpanel is moving from legacy production systems to a cloud-based one. This transformation requires a Data Operations Analyst who will work with the leadership team in leveraging your business expertise to provide best practices configuration and deployment of solutions utilizing the Atlassian product suite, such as Jira.

UK, France & Iberia markets are the 2024 priority with roll out in Latam, Asia and rest of the world during following months. It is an exciting time to be part of the next stage of growth for Kantar and the Worldpanel division. You will be tasked to developed, setup and maintain Atlassian workflows and requests to allow teams to have a more suitable legacy system and more integrated and setup and maintain dashboards to collaborate it.
You will work closely with a diverse range of key company stakeholders (within PRISM Factory) based in the UK, France, Portugal, Spain, and other region.

WHAT'D YOU DO:
Data Analysis:
Analyse business documents and configure based on specifications.
Participate in presales interactions and review requirements.
Ability to work in an agile working environment with the ability to provide feedback on requests to workflow changes and business process.
Execute configurations and testing of product implementations.
Complete Documentation of configured features and review with Sr Stakeholders.
Able to provide ongoing support on different projects.
Ability to identify the root cause of client issues, and work with internal experts to correctly deploy changes.
Internal work collaboration with different teams, as well as contribute materials to corporate Blog posts.
Work independently on assigned tasks, with the ability to take initiative independently.


WHAT'D YOU BRING:
Bachelor’s degree in data science, Statistics, Mathematics, IT or related field (or equivalent experience).
Proven experience in advanced Excel, Power BI (Required), SQL, Python, JIRA and Azure DevOps (Desired).
Atlassian Workflow and Requests build – Mandatory
Familiar with software development, technology management and delivery, and/or IT operations.
Understanding of Agile Development Principles and Team Software Development is an asset.
Familiarity in either Agile, practices, Service Management/ITSM, PMP
Technical/software configuration skills, including User interface-based configuration an asset.
Excellent interpersonal and highly developed communication skills (verbal and written).
Previous experience working in a corporate environment is an asset.
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
Effective communication skills to explain technical results to non-technical people.
Relevant certifications in Atlassian mentioned are welcome.
Proficiency with database languages such as SQL.
Fluent in English

Tools Experience: 
Excel - Required
Power BI - Required
SQL - Desired skills
Atlassian - Mandatory skills
Azure DevOps - Desired skills

Description:
About the job
Location : Mohali

City : mohali

State : Punjab (IN-PB)

Country : India (IN)

Requisition Number : 33261

 Global Role :  Data Analyst

 Local Role :  Data Analyst

 Function:  Enterprise Data Management (EDM)

 Designation:  Team Lead / Associate Manager

 Reporting to:  Global EDM Head

 SUMMARY OF ROLE: 

The Data Analyst is responsible for leading and supporting EDM projects, Data Quality Improvement and is accountable to work with Global/Region Master Data team to ensure successful project outcomes, data quality improvement goals are defined, understood, and met.

Has broad understanding for supporting and driving multiple data domains to define & execute project scope and deliverables.

This role is viewed as a technofunctional expert in the master data management domains (Customer, Supplier, Material and Finance). He/She will be required to collaborate with a multiple Bunge stakeholder spread across the globe from Business, IT and others stakeholder in order to define and achieve a mutually agreed outcome in the master data domains.

This role is expected to work closely with:

 Business Subject Matter Experts to understand requirement details for executing timely solutions.
 Business Data Owners to ensure alignment with domain priorities such as getting data rules & requirements.
 IT team to provide functional domain expertise.
 Requirements are gathered effectively.
 Delivery Partner teams (both internal and external) to ensure requirements, specifications, design and delivery are high quality and meet business expectations.
 Works closely with other Bunge IT teams to align the functional requirements to ensure integrated technology solutions are seamlessly executed across technology platforms and areas of responsibility.

 KEY FUNCTIONS: 

 Responsible to support end to end business requirements (Solutioning) – requirement gathering, translate into Functional specifications.
 Support and engage with business to gather requirements, workshops, features listing, Prioritizing, negotiation of scope and priorities with business.
 Support to define project sequence, scope and deliverables as the Business Analyst.
 Support business UAT, organize the business UAT test scenarios, triage business test defects.
 Support to drive implementation of master data solutions on time and without affecting or impacting business processes.
 Builds relationships with internal and external service providers and support teams to ensure effective project delivery.
 Maintains in-depth understanding of processes and capability needs for master data.
 Understanding data policies; significant contribution to strategic direction on governing master data.
 Proactive analysis of business processes and identification of innovative ways to address business needs and address them appropriately in a timely manner.
 Leads Continuous Improvement (CI) initiatives; consults and shares knowledge across organization; full awareness of industry trends related to master data around both ‘Customer and Supplier’ .

 DEPARTMENT SPECIFIC FUNCTIONS AND REQUIEREMENTS (Must have): 

 Direct experience in data migration, data enrichment, data Management solutions.
 Hands-on knowledge of key technologies including SAP MDG, MDM, SAP ECC/Hana
 Excellent knowledge and domain expertise in SAP ERP Customer, Vendor and FI – Chart of Accounts (COA), Profit center, company code, GL Codes Master data (Any two).
 Experience with Data Dictionaries and Metadata management.

 MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS FOR THIS ROLE: 

 Education required/ preferred: 

 B.Tech / MCA / BE

 Experience: 

 Minimum 6 years of professional data management experience
 Minimum 4 years of working and supporting data migration, integration, data enrichment in SAP MDG / S4 Hana
 Experience in translating business requirements into functional (information/data) design, establishing data models and preferably converting functional design to technical design
 Have a good understanding of the Data Life Cycle Management and Customer, Material, Vendor and Finance - Create/Update process is a MUST
 Strong experience in working closely with S4 Hana data structures and interface.
 Able to work in a virtual team which may work across distance (remote), cultures and time zones

Bunge (NYSE: BG) is a world leader in sourcing, processing and supplying oilseed and grain products and ingredients. Founded in 1818, Bunge’s expansive network feeds and fuels a growing world, creating sustainable products and opportunities for more than 70,000 farmers and the consumers they serve across the globe. The company is headquartered in St. Louis, Missouri and has 25,000 employees worldwide who stand behind more than 350 port terminals, oilseed processing plants, grain facilities, and food and ingredient production and packaging facilities around the world.

Bunge is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, national origin, citizenship, age, disability or military or veteran status, or any other legally protected status. Bunge is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled

Title: Data Analyst
Company: Siemens · Bengaluru, Karnataka, India · Reposted 1 month ago
Experience Level:
Full-time
Matches your job preferences, job type is Full-time.
Description:
About the job
Hello go-getter! 

We know that a business only thrives if our people are thriving. That’s why we always put our people first. Our global and diverse team would be happy to support you and challenge you to grow in many ways. Who knows where our joint journey will take you?

Siemens Global Business Services (GBS) is a Siemens Service Company that provides innovative digital solutions and customer-oriented business services. With more than 20 years of experience, Siemens GBS taps into its understanding of how organizations and businesses work to seamlessly integrate, digitalize and optimize business processes with a portfolio that covers end-to-end business needs.

You’ll make an impact by:

As a Data Analyst at Siemens (GBS) you will play a crucial role in extracting meaningful insights from various datasets to support data-driven decision-making processes. The candidate should have a proven track record of handling complex data sets, implementing data analysis techniques, and creating insightful reports using Power BI. In addition to strong analytical skills, the ideal candidate will be well-versed in database management and possess excellent communication skills to effectively convey findings to cross-functional teams.

Data Analysis:

Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies.
Utilize statistical methods and data visualization techniques to present insights effectively.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver actionable insights.

Power BI Reporting:

Develop and maintain interactive and visually appealing dashboards using Power BI.
Understand how to structure and model data effectively using Power BI's data modeling features.
Use Power Query Editor to transform and clean data before importing it into Power BI
Create relationships between tables and define hierarchies for optimal data representation.
Master DAX, a formula language used in Power BI for creating custom calculations and aggregations.
Write complex DAX expressions for measures, calculated columns, and calculated tables.
Incorporate advanced analytics features, including forecasting, clustering, and trend analysis.
Transform raw data into meaningful visualizations for business stakeholders.
Provide training and support to end-users on Power BI functionalities.

Database Management:

Design and maintain databases to ensure data integrity and availability.
Optimize database performance and troubleshoot issues as they arise.
Collaborate with IT teams to implement data security best practices.

Data Quality Assurance:

Implement data quality checks to ensure accuracy and reliability of data.
Identify and resolve data quality issues in a timely manner.

You’ll win us over by:

Bachelor’s degree in engineering or science.
5-6 years of experience in a data analyst role.
Advanced proficiency in Power BI for creating interactive dashboards.
Good Knowledge of Microsoft Excel.
Proficient in SQL for data extraction and manipulation.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Attention to detail, must be a quick learner with problem-solving aptitude
Strong communication and presentation skills.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
Programming skills in languages like Python.
Experience with data warehousing and ETL processes.
Knowledge of industry-specific data regulations and compliance.
Advanced statistical analysis skills.

Create a better #TomorrowWithUs! 

We value your unique identity and perspective and are fully committed to providing equitable opportunities and building a workplace that reflects the diversity of society. Come bring your authentic self and create a better tomorrow with us.

Protecting the environment, conserving our natural resources, fostering the health and performance of our people as well as safeguarding their working conditions are core to our social and business commitment at Siemens. They are an integral part of our Business Conduct Guidelines and our corporate strategy.

This role is based in Bangalore. But you’ll also get to visit other locations in India and globe, so you’ll need to go where this journey takes you. In return, you’ll get the chance to work with teams impacting entire cities, countries and the shape of things to come. We’re Siemens. A collection of over 379,000 minds building the future, one day at a time in over 200 countries.

Title: Data Analyst
Company: Qventus, Inc · Noida, Uttar Pradesh, India · 1 month ago
Experience Level: Contract Mid-Senior level
Description:
About the job
About Us: 

Qventus is a real-time decision-making platform for hospital operations. Our mission is to simplify how healthcare operates so that hospitals and caregivers can focus on delivering the best possible care to patients. We use artificial intelligence and machine learning to create products that help nurses, doctors, and hospital staff anticipate issues and make operational decisions proactively.

About the Role: 

We’re looking for a Data Analyst to join our Product Analytics team. You will use your skills in SQL and data visualization to help build and maintain impactful analytics products for both our clients and internal teams.

You’ll work closely with our product, design, and engineering teams to illuminate both the operational opportunities in our client hospitals as well as the entire impact chain of our product. By building a deep understanding of what Qventus does and how it improves the delivery of healthcare for our customers, you’ll evaluate the best ways to measure and visualize the performance of our company’s tools and algorithms.

The most important thing to the role will be your ability to balance speed with reliability. It will require your:

Strong SQL skills and comfort working with complex, interrelated datasets
Familiarity with visualization tools. We use Looker, but experience with Tableau, PowerBI, R Shiny, MatPlotLib, or any other similar tool or library is sufficient.
Ability to trace data anomalies from dashboards back to the precipitating log events
Constant curiosity about the problems to be solved (not just the technical execution)


Key Responsibilities:

Support repeatable analyses that drive insights into how our products are being used and how they affect our healthcare customers’ goals
Deliver ad-hoc analyses to support our Delivery team and client satisfaction
Support our analytics products, including troubleshooting queries, supporting dashboard rollouts to new clients, and developing new analytic features
Contribute to the health of our analytics platform (e.g. deployments and documentation)


What We’re Looking For: 

3+ years experience in a data-centric role (analytics, science, engineering)
Significant experience leveraging SQL to answer applied business analytics questions
Some experience using modern data visualization tools (Looker preferred)
A love for the big picture and a healthy obsession with the details
Deep curiosity and a passion for real-world impact
High proficiency in spoken and written English


It’s a Plus if You Have… 

Experience with US Healthcare data: EHRs and/or claims
Experience with dbt
Experience with data modeling and proper schema design
Working, hands on, knowledge of modern data warehouses (Snowflake preferred) 
Experience with Looker and comfort with LookML
Advanced degree in statistics, economics, or other quantitative field


Qventus is on a mission to take modern technologies and principles that have been proven in other industries — artificial intelligence, machine learning, behavioral science, and data science — and apply them to simplify healthcare operations. At Qventus, you will have the opportunity to work with an exceptional, mission-driven team, and the ability to impact the lives of patients directly. We’re inspired to work with healthcare leaders on our founding vision and unlock world-class medicine through world-class operations.

Title: Data Analyst I
Company: Apex Group Ltd (India Branch) · Pune, Maharashtra, India · Reposted 6 days ago
Experience Level:
On-site
Matches your job preferences, workplace type is On-site.
Full-time
Matches your job preferences, job type is Full-time.
Entry level
Description:
About the job
Role: Data Analyst

Department: Data Office

Reporting to: Head of Data & Insight

Location:

About Apex

Apex Group Ltd., established in Bermuda in 2003, is a global financial services provider. With over 80 offices in 70 countries worldwide and more than 12,000 employees, Apex Group delivers an expansive range of services to asset managers, financial institutions, private clients and family offices. The Group has continually improved and evolved its capabilities to offer a single-source solution through establishing the broadest range of services in the industry; including fund services, digital onboarding and bank accounts, depositary, custody, super ManCo services, corporate services including HR and Payroll and a pioneering ESG Ratings and Advisory solution. Apex Group’s purpose is to be more than just a financial services provider and is committed to driving positive change to address three core areas; the Environment and Climate Change, Women’s Empowerment and Economic Independence, Education and Social Mobility.

Life at Apex isn't just about the work you do, it's about embracing the culture and loving what you do. Every employee plays a part in making Apex who we are today and the more that we grow, the more important that becomes. Whatever your career path or specialism Apex ensures it rewards loyal and dedicated employees. The international nature of our business and global network of offices means that there are opportunities to broaden your life experiences and take both short-term or permanent relocation options.

Job Specification

We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our team. As a Data Analyst, you will play a vital role in collecting, analysing, and interpreting complex data sets to provide actionable insights and support data-driven decision-making across the organization. You will collaborate closely with various stakeholders to identify business needs, design data models, perform statistical analysis, and present findings in a clear and concise manner. The ideal candidate has a strong analytical mindset, advanced data manipulation skills, and a passion for extracting valuable information from raw data.

Responsibilities

Collect, clean, and transform large data sets from multiple sources into usable formats for analysis.
Develop and maintain efficient data models, databases, and reporting systems.
Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets to support strategic business decisions.
Conduct statistical analysis and generate meaningful reports and visualizations to communicate findings effectively.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define key performance indicators (KPIs) and develop metrics for measuring business performance.
Identify data quality issues, troubleshoot problems, and implement solutions to ensure data accuracy and integrity.
Monitor and evaluate data collection processes to optimize efficiency and effectiveness.
Stay updated with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in data analysis and visualization.
Present findings, insights, and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner, both verbally and in written reports.

Requirements

Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field. A master's degree is a plus.
Proven work experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role, with a focus on data manipulation, analysis, and visualization.
Proficiency in SQL and advanced data manipulation techniques.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Python libraries (e.g., Matplotlib, Seaborn) to create impactful reports and dashboards.
Knowledge of statistical analysis methods and tools (e.g., regression analysis, hypothesis testing, clustering).
Familiarity with data warehousing concepts and ETL processes.
Proficiency and experience using Cloud Technologies including AWS, Azure
Experience using Snowflake.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R for data analysis and manipulation.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to present technical information to non-technical stakeholders.
Attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy and integrity.
Ability to work independently and collaborate effectively in a team-oriented environment.

Preferred Skills (not Required But Considered a Plus)

Experience with machine learning techniques and predictive modelling.
Knowledge of big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) and distributed computing.
Understanding of data privacy regulations and best practices (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA).

Join our dynamic team and contribute to our organization's growth by harnessing the power of data!

What You Will Get In Return

A genuinely unique opportunity to be part of an expanding large global business. Joining Apex Group will provide you with a platform for professional and personal success and an environment where you can truly make an impact.

Our people are our greatest asset and we believe learning is central to developing talent, nurturing strong leaders, fostering a supportive company culture and ultimately drives our success.

Title: Data Analyst
Company: TMI Network · Hyderabad, Telangana, India · 3 weeks ago
Experience Level:
Full-time
Matches your job preferences, job type is Full-time.
Mid-Senior level
Description:
About the job
Minimum Relevant Experience Required: 4 Years
Preferred Industry: Insurance (not mandatory)

Role Summary

The data analyst is responsible for organizing data from various sources related to products/services, market research or other external entities. Utilize technical expertise to ensure data is accurate and high-quality. Data is then analyzed, designed, and presented in a way that assists individuals, businesses, and organization make better decisions.

Ethical Judgement - Recognizing the ethical implications of data usage, storage, and analysis, especially in terms of privacy and security
Excellent communication and presentation skills - Clearly convey findings, both written and orally, to non-technical stakeholders. This includes creating reports and presentations that gives the insights from the data
Problem Solving - Have a systematic and logical approach to problem-solving. Coming up with solutions to business problems using data-driven approaches
Critical thinking - Ability to approach problems logically and make informed decisions based on the data
Attention to Details - Ensuring accuracy in data analysis and recognizing anomalies or errors in data
Team work - Collaborating with other departments or teams, understanding their needs, and providing them with relevant data insights

Responsibilities

Using automated tools to extract data from primary and secondary sources
Remove corrupted data and fixing coding errors and related problems
Developing and maintaining databases, and data systems – reorganizing data in a readable format Performing analysis to assess the quality and meaning of data
Filter Data by reviewing reports and performance indicators to identify and correct code problems
Using statistical tools to identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets could be helpful for the diagnosis and prediction
Assigning numerical value to essential business functions so that business performance can be assessed and compared over periods of time.
Analyzing local, national, and global trends that impact both the organization and the industry Preparing reports for the management stating trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data
Working with programmers, engineers, and management heads to identify process improvement opportunities, propose system modifications, and devise data governance strategies
Preparing final analysis reports for the stakeholders to understand the data-analysis steps, enabling them to take important decisions based on various facts and trends
Another integral element is EDA or Exploratory Data Analysis Project. In such data analyst projects, the analyst needs to scrutinize data to recognize and identify patterns. 
Use data modeling techniques to summarize the overall features of data analysis

Essential Data Analyst Skills

A mix of technical, analytical, and soft skills to effectively analyze data and communicate their findings. Here are some essential skills:

Data Cleaning and PreparationVery strong expertise in cleaning and preparing data for analysis. This includes removing errors, identifying outliers, and transforming data into a format that can be analyzed.
Data Analysis and ExplorationAbility to analyze data and explore it for insights. This includes using statistical methods to test hypotheses, identify trends, and make predictions. 
Statistical AnalysisUnderstanding statistical tests and tools is crucial. Familiarity with mean, median, variance, standard deviation, correlation, regression, and hypothesis testing can be fundamental. 
ProgrammingPython: Libraries like pandas, numpy, and scikit-learn are essential for data manipulation and analysis R: For statistical analysis and data visualization
Database ManagementAbility to query databases using SQL is essential for extracting data Knowledge of database systems: MS SQL or MongoDB
Creating Dashboards and ReportsCreate dashboards and reports that communicate insights to stakeholders. This includes using tools like Tableau, Power BI, and Microsoft Word to create interactive dashboards and reports.
Data VisualizationUsing tools and libraries: Tableau, Power BI, Matplotlib, Seaborn, or ggplot2 to represent data in a visual format that's easy to understand. 
Machine LearningProficient in machine learning is highly desirable to automate tasks, identify patterns, and make predictions. 
Excel - Very strong expertise in MS Excel

Company: HRS Group · Chandigarh, Chandigarh, India · 3 weeks ago
Experience Level:

Full-time
Matches your job preferences, job type is Full-time.
