Description:
About the job
This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.  

You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.

With the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. When you join Team Amex, you become part of a global and diverse community of colleagues with an unwavering commitment to back our customers, communities and each other. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we help you create a career journey that’s unique and meaningful to you with benefits, programs, and flexibility that support you personally and professionally.

At American Express, you’ll be recognized for your contributions, leadership, and impact—every colleague has the opportunity to share in the company’s success. Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to provide the world’s best customer experience every day. And we’ll do it with the utmost integrity, and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they belong.

Join Team Amex and let’s lead the way together.

Overview Of The Business

Credit and Fraud Risk (CFR) team helps drive profitable business growth by reducing the risk of fraud and maintaining industry lowest credit loss rates. It uses an array of tools and ever-evolving technology to detect and combat fraud, minimize the disruption of good spending, and provide a world-class customer experience. The team leads efforts that leverage data and digital advancements to improve risk management as well as enable commerce and drive innovation.

A single decision can have many outcomes. And when that decision affects millions of customers, it needs to be the right one. That’s where our Credit & Fraud Risk (CFR) Analytics & Data Science CoE team comes in. The team leads efforts that leverage data and digital advancements to improve risk management as well as enable commerce and drive innovation, every day. Right from targeting the right customer for our products to underwriting them to managing their experience with Amex when they get onboarded, every decision is advised by groundbreaking analytics & data science. We help the company grow its business profitably while delivering the world's best customer experience, all powered by data. We are the backbone of all financial services operations at American Express and impact every aspect of the company.

As a part of the team, you’ll have the opportunity to work in one of the best companies for data scientists in the country. You will solve real world business problems while getting exposure to the industry’s top leaders in analytics, data science and machine learning. If you’re passionate about solving complex problems and crafting solutions that impact millions, you should consider a career in CFR.

Description On The Role

Development, deployment and validation of predictive model(s) and supporting use of models in economic logic to enable profitable decisions across risk, fraud and marketing.

Responsibilities

Understand the core business of AXP and the levers behind various decisions
Analyze large amounts of data to derive business insights and create innovative solutions 
Leverage the power of closed loop through Amex network to make decisions more intelligent and relevant 
Innovate with a focus on developing newer and better approaches using big data & machine learning solution 
Clear articulation and structuring of business findings across prospect and customer domain to the leadership and key partners
Maintain external lens and be aware of developments in the field of Finance/Payments/Analytics etc.

Minimum Qualifications

 MBA, Master’s Degree In Economics, Statistics, Computer Science Or related fields 
 0-30 months of experience in analytics, big data workstreams (24-48 months of experience for Sr. Analyst Req)
 Ability to drive project deliverables to achieve business results 
 Ability to work effectively in a team environment 
 Strong communication and interpersonal skills 
 Innovative problem solver with ability to learn quickly and work independently with complex, unstructured initiatives 
 Ability to Integrate with Cross-Functional Business Partners Worldwide 
 SAS, R, Python, Hive, Spark, SQL 
 Unsupervised and supervised techniques -: active learning, transfer learning, neural models, Decision trees, reinforcement learning, graphical models, Gaussian processes, Bayesian models, Map Reduce techniques, attribute engineering

Preferred Qualifications

Expertise in Coding, Algorithm, High Performance Computing

Benefits

We back our colleagues and their loved ones with benefits and programs that support their holistic well-being. That means we prioritize their physical, financial, and mental health through each stage of life. Benefits include:

Competitive base salaries 
Bonus incentives 
Support for financial-well-being and retirement 
Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability benefits (depending on location) 
Flexible working model with hybrid, onsite or virtual arrangements depending on role and business need 
Generous paid parental leave policies (depending on your location) 
Free access to global on-site wellness centers staffed with nurses and doctors (depending on location) 
Free and confidential counseling support through our Healthy Minds program 
Career development and training opportunities

American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.

Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.

Description:
About the job
We are looking for Lead Healthcare Research & Data Analyst for Clarivate Bangalore team to work on the Medtech Insights team, offering therapeutic and methodological expertise to clients as well as internally. These experienced individuals are able to work independently and as part of a team to help us promote a positive work environment, produce superior content, and continuously improve. Senior analysts will experience numerous exciting opportunities during their tenure at Clarivate including:

About You – Experience, Education, Skills, And Accomplishments

At least 7 years of relevant experience in forecasting in healthcare domain
Master’s degree in life science/ Healthcare (MA, MS in life sciences or MBA) is required.
Well-developed therapy expertise in at least one area of the medical device market, Market Research or related work experience
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including using pivot tables and advanced formulas such as VLOOKUP, effective data organization strategies etc.
Highly self-motivated and able to work independently or with a team to produce high quality deliverables that require little rework.
Business acumen that helps support sales success, ongoing improvements, and relationships with internal and external stakeholder.

What will you be doing in this role?

Searching Clarivate 's proprietary in-house research repository/library for relevant data
Interviewing industry participants and related medical professionals
Stakeholder management, mentoring and guiding the junior team members, involve in project improvements etc
Using financial, regulatory, and government documents to find key medical approval data
Modelling and forecasting medical device markets, including but not limited to:
Scoping areas of emerging interest to our clients
Integrating highly disparate data points into a unified market model
Interpreting qualitative data into useable quantitative measures
Creating hypotheses on market and competitive dynamics based on primary and secondary data
Using MS Excel to manipulate large amounts of procedure code, purchasing, and other types of data
Forecasting markets based on expectations, new product developments, and other market disruptors
Identifying data trends and outliers through the use of time-series tables and graphs



Writing and preparing comprehensive research reports. Examples include:
Providing insightful market analyses to explain trends and support accompanying market figures
Writing in-depth competitive analyses based on primary and secondary research
Illustrating key market trends with graphs
Integrating numerical data points into tables and text
Drawing hypotheses on potential competitive strategies in these markets


In addition, Lead Healthcare Research & Data Analyst are often asked to:

Add insight and perspective to Clarivate’s syndicated data products and custom projects
Provide timely, professional responses to customer inquiries, complaints, feedback, and comments
Attend onsite client visits, acting as Clarivate’s key market expert, as required
Assist sales/marketing with information to better sell & market products as required
Participate in thought leadership activities. Examples include: writing healthcare related blogs, conducting webinars, participating in social media initiatives, and presenting at conferences, as required
Support project management of junior team members’ deliverables
Demonstrate a commitment to excellence through accurate deliverables that are consistent with quality standards.

About The Team

The Med tech Insights team Consists of 25 members & is an essential part of the broader Med tech team’s data-driven culture, and regularly contributes its subject matter expertise to other teams within the organization.

Hours of Work 

Mon- Friday (12:00PM IST to 9:00PM IST), Hy-brid work mode

Location - Bangalore

At Clarivate, we are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all persons with respect to hiring, compensation, promotion, training and other terms, conditions and privileges of employment. We comply with applicable laws and regulations governing non-discrimination in all locations.

Description:
About the job
Commercial Banking WFIP - Bangalore, India Wells Fargo is seeking a Senior Lead Client Insights Analyst to help drive strategic, digitally focused solutions for our Commercial Banking & Corporate Investment Banking (CB-CIB) Lending customers. Our mission is to deliver value to our customers and our business partners by providing best-in-class digital experiences. We put our customers at the center of every decision we make by focusing on their needs, being a leader in digital solutions and keeping things simple. We bring together a unique set of experts in digital product management, design, and analytics. As a Senior Lead Client Insights Analyst, you will gather and analyze customer data, competitors, and market research to provide valuable insights into client behaviors and experiences guiding digital strategy. You will work with a wide range of data sources, including market research surveys, external reports as well as internal Voice of the Customer and operational data. The successful candidate will leverage their well-rounded analytical and business skills, communication skills, and must be a team player. For additional information on this line of business, refer to the external Careers Site at www.wellsfargojobs.com

In This Role, You Will

 Collaborate with cross-functional teams to interpret data, identify trends, and make data-driven recommendations to improve customer experiences and business and digital strategies
 Perform quantitative and qualitative research into consumers, competitors, and the marketplace in collaboration with partners to identify trends, opportunities, and threats relevant to specific engagements
 Analyze disparate customer data sets to identify trends, key indicators, patterns, and insights to inform decision-making
 Support research, analysis & development of current experience pain points, trends & new opportunities
 Create impactful visualizations/storytelling through data, to support the commercial banking team's strategic initiatives
 Consult with partners to identify data sources, usage, benchmarks and metrics
 Identify areas of improvement and opportunities for collaborating with peers to develop business and value cases aiding recommendation adoption and backlog prioritization

Required Qualifications

 Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Marketing, Data Science or related field
 7+ years of experience in commercial banking, market or industry research, Business Analysis, Analytics, Customer Insights or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education
 Understanding of banking, technology, FinTechs
 Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
 Ability to work independently and collaboratively
 Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
 Ability to execute in a fast paced, high demand, environment while balancing multiple priorities

Desired Qualifications

 Experienced in managing a wide range of qualitative and quantitative research
 Excellent research and writing and presentation skills, creating crisp visualizations to convey complex stories

Posting End Date:

14 Apr 2024

Job posting may come down early due to volume of applicants.

We Value Diversity

At Wells Fargo, we believe in diversity, equity and inclusion in the workplace; accordingly, we welcome applications for employment from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, color, gender, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, individuals with disabilities, pregnancy, marital status, status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable law.

Employees support our focus on building strong customer relationships balanced with a strong risk mitigating and compliance-driven culture which firmly establishes those disciplines as critical to the success of our customers and company. They are accountable for execution of all applicable risk programs (Credit, Market, Financial Crimes, Operational, Regulatory Compliance), which includes effectively following and adhering to applicable Wells Fargo policies and procedures, appropriately fulfilling risk and compliance obligations, timely and effective escalation and remediation of issues, and making sound risk decisions. There is emphasis on proactive monitoring, governance, risk identification and escalation, as well as making sound risk decisions commensurate with the business unit's risk appetite and all risk and compliance program requirements.

Title: Forecasting Analyst
Company: AstraZeneca · Chennai, Tamil Nadu, India · Reposted 1 week ago
Experience Level:
Full-time
Matches your job preferences, job type is Full-time.
Entry level
Description:
About the job
Job Title - Forecasting Analyst

Career Level - C3

About Astrazeneca

AstraZeneca is a global, science-led, patient-focused biopharmaceutical company that focuses on the discovery, development, and commercialization of prescription medicines for some of the world’s most serious disease. But we’re more than one of the world’s leading pharmaceutical companies. At AstraZeneca we’re dedicated to being a Great Place to Work.

Who we are: 

The Global Business Service (GBS) team sits within Finance at AstraZeneca and is a dynamic and results-oriented environment and provides a range of enterprise-wide services. We dare to change the way we work by freeing up the business to push the boundaries of science to deliver life-changing medicines. We aim to do this by freeing up time, freeing up money, protecting AZ’s value and providing new capabilities.

What we do: 

A trusted partner to the business, we’re on a mission to make AstraZeneca more agile, efficient and effective. Through our hybrid model of in-house delivery centers and service towers across the globe, we’re reimagining how we work. Here we drive new ways of working and operating models, process simplification and innovative solutions, whilst ensuring that automation and data is at the heart of everything.

How we do it:

Be part of a team building a community. We interact with diverse cultures and perspectives and are united by our sense of belonging. This is the place to learn and grow together.

Why we love it:


As a growing multi-national company, there’s so much potential to develop. Embrace opportunities at a global business that’s facing new and varied challenges. This is the place to build an exemplary, international CV.
A fun place to be, we’re creating community hubs that build partnerships, not just working relationships.
We’re on an exciting journey to take our team to the next stage. This is the place to leave a legacy behind.


About The Role

The Senior Forecaster works closely with the GIACE Forecast Leader, Forecast Manager and Commercial teams to develop brand forecasts (revenue, volume and patients) for strategic brands and / or early assets for Global (focus on Top 8 markets) or US. As a Forecast Manager, you will play an important role in this process, understanding the assigned therapeutic area and brand, setting expectations for performance and helping guide brand strategy.

Together with the Forecast Leader and Forecast Manager, the Senior Forecaster will develop product-specific short-term and long-term forecast models and maintain up-to-date models that reflect current data, information and assumptions; be responsible for the assigned forecasting, business planning processes and associated work streams (sales bridges, ad-hocs supporting Finance, etc.); identify and clearly surface key business issues that impact the forecasts; incorporate the results of primary research into the forecast model(s) to reflect anticipated risks and opportunities on sales outlook, and help define forecasting processes and building of capabilities. In addition, you will have responsibility to develop forecasts for your assigned therapeutic area using patient-based forecast models, ensuring alignment on forecast assumptions and other critical analytical assessments with business partners including GIACE, Marketing, Sales, Market Access and Pricing, Finance and Sales Operations.

Key Responsibilities


Responsible for the timely delivery of robust and visible demand forecasts for strategic brands / therapy areas and key markets, including clear documentation of assumptions as well as levels of confidence / robustness
Authoritatively / confidently present and defend forecast approach, methodology, assumptions and output to senior leadership
Ensure objectivity and robustness around the forecast via identification of the right data sources and application of industry-leading modeling approaches, with sensitivity analyses around key variables to assist in opportunity and risk management
Demonstrate a high level of understanding of the points of integration of our work and that of our colleagues.
Develop new product introduction volume forecasts, both short-term and long-term, to champion into strategic and operational planning processes.
Support continuous improvement and innovation to evolve the existing forecasting capabilities in terms of benefit, risk / opportunity / uncertainty, methodologies (including statistical, predictive, simulations / Monte Carlo, ranges, deep knowledge of key data sets) to inform forecasts and decision-making
Proactively leverage appropriate information into forecast via a variety of tools and sources
For Global Forecasting roles: support development new forecast models as business requirements emerge (e.g. pipeline / early assets, LCM, business development)
For US Forecasting roles: participate in monthly S&OP process and submit volumes; support development of weekly / monthly / yearly models and conversions.


Educational requirements:


Bachelor’s Degree in relevant field


Experience: 


2+ years of direct Pharmaceutical forecasting experience with a solid knowledge of forecasting techniques, models and approaches
Experience utilizing a range of data sources and analytics involving standard data in the Pharmaceutical industry – e.g. IQVIA (MIDAS, DDD NPA, Monthly Xponent), claims data (Truven, Marketscan), epidemiological data, etc. For US forecasting, experience with TRx / NBRx / NRx data and methodologies
Strong analytical expertise; superior Excel, financial modelling and forecasting skills
Project management experience including risk mitigation, planning and running multiple projects running in parallel
Ability to build trusted relationships across a range of partner groups including Marketing, Analytics, Operations, and Technology
Demonstrated experience in problem solving and continuous improvement
Strong written and verbal communication


Preferred:


Good understanding of one or more disease areas and how patients move through their respective diagnosis and treatment pathways, including treatment dynamics
Experience integrating insights from market research and secondary data analysis into forecast assumptions
Knowledge of advanced statistical forecast methodologies and applied AI / ML / automation
Experience working with Power Apps, specifically PowerBI
For US forecasting, working knowledge of US Market Access and gross-to-net.

We’re a network of high-reaching self-starters who contribute to something far bigger. We enable AstraZeneca to perform at its peak by delivering premier technology and data solutions.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Company: Criteo · Gurgaon, Haryana, India · 5 days ago
Experience Level:
Remote
Matches your job preferences, workplace type is Remote.
Full-time
Matches your job preferences, job type is Full-time.
Mid-Senior level
Description:
About the job
What You'll Do:

The Global Automation team develops and runs a wide range of internal solutions that empower Criteo’s commercial and operations teams to maximize their business impact by scaling its operations while boosting the efficient delivery of value to clients.

In your role as a Senior Data Analyst, you will be a key member of the team by leading data analyses to help the team make better-informed product decisions, building comprehensive reports to visualize data, and enabling mechanisms to accurately measure our impact.

You will closely collaborate with a talented team of product managers, UX designers, software engineers, and the leadership team in an agile, dynamic, and multicultural work environment to facilitate the enablement of internal teams and ultimately help drive a significant impact on our business.

This role is based in either Gurgaon, India, or Hyderabad, India

As this role supports our global business, work hours will be between 12:30 pm IST to 09:30 pm IST (March – October) and 1:30 PM IST to 10:30 PM IST during daylight savings (November – February)

In your role, reporting directly to the Product Director, your primary responsibilities will include:

Engage with the product team and other internal stakeholders to understand and define what data is essential to measure the impact of our work.
Partner with engineering on the implementation of tracking needed to measure impact. 
Translate business requirements into specific analyses, metrics, or reports that generate


actionable insights. 

Investigate data visualization needs within Global Automation, translate obtained insights


into actions and present those to the team to support decision-making processes. 

Analyze product data to identify trends, patterns, and insights to inform strategic business


decisions in product development. 

Enable stakeholders to access data and monitor key business metrics by being expert


in building and maintaining dashboards and reports. 

Create and present reports and ad-hoc analyses to the leadership team to help make better-informed decisions 


Who You Are:

Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative/business field (Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Economics, Business, Finance, etc.). 
At least 6+ years of work experience in a business/data analytics role, preferably from a consulting, product-tech, retail, or e-commerce background. 
Strong intellectual curiosity and ability to structure and solve difficult problems with minimal supervision. 
Excellent technical skills: strong SQL, basic Python, and advanced proficiency in Excel & Tableau (or similar visualization tools) are a must.
Effective business acumen & strong communication skills to provide clear actionable insights. 
Experience in any of the following is a plus: Hive/Hadoop, Vertica, Git/Gerrit 
Knowledge in agency or digital marketing is a plus.


We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

About the job
Role Overview

The Data Science and Analytics team is expanding within the Consumer Marketing organization, with a laser focus on building data tools, supporting experimentation, developing predictive models, and extracting data-driven insights to achieve our goals as a direct-to-consumer marketing organization that supports 400 million customers worldwide. With a focus on our consumer business, this is an opportunity to work with creative finance and businesspeople who are change agents for our business practices and methodologies, affecting top-line revenue.

This is a remote position in India. We will only consider candidates currently in India and are not offering relocation assistance at this time.

About The Role

Design, develop and automate data tools and dashboards that allow to monitor metrics in a highly scalable self-service way.
Implement data hygiene, data standardization and data transformation that optimizes other data processes.
Work with Marketing specialists to form creative solutions and design tools to support experimentation.
Build well-managed data solutions, tools, and capabilities to enable self-service frameworks for data consumers.
Perform on-going validation of metrics definitions and define new metrics required to aid successful business measurement.
Identify opportunities to automate the reports, dashboards and tools and Run data analysis to support experimentation, convert analytical findings into customer insights that power marketing strategies and programs across end-to-end customer journey.

About You

A Master's or bachelor’s degree in information technology, software engineering, computer science, or related fields is preferred.
5+ years of progressive experience in a data analyst role, including data mining, data transformation, and delivering relevant insights.
5+ years of experience in programming with SQL, Python, or R for exploring and transforming data within a relational database environment.
3+ years of experience in statistical testing (frequentist A/B testing, Bayesian A/B testing, or multivariate testing) and the design of experiments.
3+ years of experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, R Shiny, D3.js, etc

Company Overview

McAfee is a leader in personal security for consumers. Focused on protecting people, not just devices, McAfee consumer solutions adapt to users’ needs in an always online world, empowering them to live securely through integrated, intuitive solutions that protects their families and communities with the right security at the right moment.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Company: Morgan Advanced Materials · Chennai, Tamil Nadu, India · 4 months ago
Experience Level:
On-site
Matches your job preferences, workplace type is On-site.
Full-time
Matches your job preferences, job type is Full-time.
Entry level
Employee Count/Domain: 5,001-10,000 employees · Glass, Ceramics and Concrete Manufacturing
Description:
About the job
Morgan Advanced Materials  is a business rich in history and innovation. Founded in the UK in 1856, we have grown into a global organisation with 70 sites in 18 countries. Our model to serve our customers where they need us has led to a diversified product range using our unparalleled expertise in ceramic and carbon materials, which we exploit to solve difficult problems for our customers across a diverse range of markets.

We are a purpose driven organisation. Our purpose is to use advanced materials to make the world more sustainable and to improve the quality of life. We deliver on that purpose through the products that we make, and the way that we make them.

The Thermal Ceramics division designs, manufactures and installs a broad range of thermal insulation products that significantly reduce energy consumption and emissions in a variety of high temperature processing applications. Our product offering is extensive and covers application needs from Industrial to Commercial markets.

 Key Figures:  Revenue £1,112m (2022), ~8,500 employees, manufacturing in 30+ countries, and a global customer portfolio. A UK PLC with head office located in Windsor, Berkshire UK. Listed on London Stock Exchange; Member of the FTSE 250 Index.

Responsibilities

At Morgan Advanced Materials - Thermal Ceramics division, we're on a mission to enhance our operations and drive efficiency through the power of data. As we embark on the journey towards a standardized global ERP solution, we're seeking a talented and enthusiastic Data Analyst to join our team.

In this dynamic role, you'll play a pivotal part in leveraging analytics tools and processes to support our business on a global scale. The ideal candidate will possess a strong proficiency in data analytics, encompassing mining, generation, and visualization, with a passion for transforming raw data into actionable insights.

If you're excited about tackling data and reporting challenges, and want to contribute to our ERP transformation project, we invite you to join us on this thrilling adventure.

Objectives of this Role

 Develop, implement, and maintain leading-edge data analytics solutions 
 Create best-practice reports based on data mining, analysis, and visualization. 
 Work directly with management and users to gain a deep understanding of the business requirements (from a data framework) in all operational areas: Sales, Marketing, Supply chain, Production, and Finance 
 Support in defining new data collection and processes analysis 
 Perform (master) data cleanse at local level in order to ensure accurate data in support of monthly S&OP meetings and financial decision making. 
 Identify trends and opportunities for business growth through analysis of complex data sets. 

Main Responsibilities

 Through close collaboration with the business, gain an in-depth understanding of requirements across multiple functional and operational areas. 
 Build reporting solutions based on PowerBi to deliver actionable insights to relevant decision-makers. 
 Proactively identify opportunity for process improvements, recommend system modifications, and develop policies for data governance. 
 Design and maintain master data including creation, updates and deletion; this includes fixing data errors and other data-related problems. 
 Proactively analyse data to answer key questions from stakeholders or out of self-initiated curiosity with an eye for what drives business performance, investigating and communicating areas for improvement in efficiency and productivity. 
 Creating appropriate documentation that allows stakeholders to understand the steps of the data analysis process and duplicate or replicate the analysis if necessary, on periodic basis. 
 Work closely with Global Director of Master Data Management & Business Intelligence as well as Regional IT project managers in support of global standardization project and the roll out of a transformational global ERP solution. 

Qualifications

 Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Economics, Statistics or Mathematics. 
 Relevant work experience as a data analyst with proven analytic skills, including mining, evaluation, analysis, and visualization. 
 Attention to detail with an analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving. 
 Ability to translate business requirements into executable data models and reports 
 Excellent knowledge of designing and maintaining PowerBi reports and advanced Excel skills 
 Programming experience with databases (SQL or similar) and ETL frameworks 
 Prior experience with manufacturing sector & familiarisation with relevant data entities is preferred. 
 Solid understanding of ERP applications in general needed; ideally candidate has practical experience with Microsoft Dynamics 365 and JD Edwards 

 Morgan Advanced Materials is an EEO/AA/M/W/D/V Employer Ind-1
Skills: ['Data Analytics, Databases, Extract, Transform, Load (ETL), and Microsoft Power BI', 'Business Requirements, Data Models, Infor Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP), JD Edwards, Microsoft Dynamics, and Microsoft Dynamics 365']

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Company: PVH Corp. · Bengaluru, Karnataka, India · 17 hours ago
Experience Level:
On-site
Matches your job preferences, workplace type is On-site.
Full-time
Matches your job preferences, job type is Full-time.
Mid-Senior level
Description:
About the job
Design Your Future at PVH

Senior Data Analyst

POSITION TITLE: Senior Data Analyst (Business Analytics) – PVH Supply Data & Analytics

DEPT. /DIVISION: Corporate Supply Data & Analytics

POSITION REPORTS TO: Senior Manager, Data & Analytics

LOCATION: Bangalore, India

_______________________________________________________

Position Summary

The Supply Chain Data & Analytics (SDA) team sits within the corporate Supply Chain function at PVH and is passionate about powering a world-class, data-driven Supply Chain by delivering exceptional data & analytics, driving impactful business decisions and insights. The Supply Chain Data & Analytics team plays a key role in enabling critical strategic outcomes in our supply chain.

As a part of the India-based SDA development team, the Senior Data Analyst will leverage their technical and analytical skills on multiple reporting & analytics deliverables (regular / ad-hoc / project based) enabling PVH Supply Chain leadership with data & insights to make informed decisions. The candidate will work closely with other members of the SDA Team and our global stakeholders to identify and prioritize use cases which support the current Annual Operating Plan including Cost Optimization, Delivery Performance, Availability, Supply Chain Visibility, Traceability and Sustainability as well as tracking impact of adverse market conditions / risk events. The candidate will also be involved in the development activities for the Supply Chain function on the new Data and Analytics platform (Lighthouse).

The ideal candidate must be well experienced in building data sets, reports, and dashboards with an eye for intuitive data visualization. They must also possess a curious mind and the self-motivation and drive to take a project from concept to delivery while leveraging the tools and assets at hand.

Primary Responsibilities/Accountabilities Of The Job

Analyze & report internal and external data sets relevant to PVH Supply Chain.
Use statistical methods to analyze and derive trends from the data.
Create quantitative insights using intuitive & effective visualizations, with emphasis on great user experience, for use by leadership as well as the broader supply chain organization.
Understand evolving Internal Supply chain systems landscape and architecture.
Analyze data from multiple supply chain source systems to build harmonized global metrics and insights.
Collaborate with a wide variety of stakeholders including SDA peers, Vendor Management Team, Brands and Business teams, Technology teams, Corporate Responsibility team as well as external service partners to leverage appropriate data for analysis and reporting.
Collaborate with members of the Product Management team, SDA Team and Global Stakeholders to help identify and prioritize Use Cases.
Partner with Business Analyst to gather detailed requirements and create high quality visualizations and wireframes for approved Use Cases.
Document clear and concise requirements resulting in high-quality analytics delivery.
Support design, development and management of interactive Reports, Dashboards and Visualizations within Lighthouse, as per business requirements and product roadmap.
Support testing and validation activities for the deliverables, following the quality assurance guidelines and processes, to ensure deliverables meet the functional and technical requirements, with right-first-time goal.
Work with project team and technology partners to address issues and identify potential solutions.
Perform variety analyses, hypothesis testing, and causal analyses to statistically assess data trends and communicate the insights.
Individually manage the delivery of day-to-day and ad-hoc data analysis requests supporting the PVH Supply Chain business groups as required.

_______________________________________________________________

Internal & External Contacts

Internal: SDA peers, Technology partners, Corporate Responsibility team & business teams within our global brands across the US, Europe and Asia to leverage appropriate data sources for analysis and reporting.

External: external service partners as needed.

Supervisory Responsibilities

 Direct: N/A

 Indirect: N/A

BUDGETARY RESPONSIBILITIES: N/A

DECISION MAKING:  Day-to-day decisions on data and reporting parameters and development to ensure on-time delivery of work. Evaluate issues, prioritize and escalate issues to the appropriate channels.

Resourcefulness/Creativity

Comfortable working with changing business needs and evolving strategic direction.
Able to translate data results into easy-to-understand visuals and concise executive summaries.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts.
Ability to build good working relationships; collaborates toward deadlines and deliverables. 
Self-motivated to seek connections, ask questions and challenge assumptions to understand underlying business needs and design solutions accordingly.
Must be able to identify opportunities in business problems and alleviate them through data-oriented solutions.
Must be eager to learn business and technology and flexible to upskill/cross-skill.
Ability to work on multiple projects at the same time.

ENVIRONMENT: The Senior Data Analyst will be part of the existing PVH Supply Chain Data & Analytics (SDA) team in the Bangalore office. They will report directly to Senior Manager, Data & Analytics based in Bangalore and work with SDA peers and business teams across North America, Europe and Asia.

The ideal candidate will enjoy working in a fast-paced, team-oriented setting with peers who are energized by building the future together. The team works across multiple initiatives and embraces change to drive transformational value.

________________________________________________________________

Qualifications & Experience

Experience: 4 to 6 years of relevant experience.

Education: Bachelor’s degree in Data & Analytics, Engineering, Science or similar quantitative field required, Master’s degree a plus

Technical Skills (Must Have) 

Strong ability to create clear, intuitive and meaningful data visualizations and BI deliverables.
Strong expertise in creating wireframes / mockups to visualize data.
Strong expertise with MS Excel (Pivot tables, look-up formulas, handling large volumes of data).
Intermediate to strong expertise in using PowerPoint to present analysis findings and provide insights.
Exposure to creating senior leadership level executive presentations.
Strong customer-facing written and oral communications skills.
Familiarity with agile software delivery methodologies such as Scrum.
Proficiency with data mining using SQL and working understanding open-source programming languages for data analysis (R or Python)
Ability to write complex queries to model business rules.
Solid understanding of Dimensional data models.
Ability to import/export and manipulate data to cleanse / mine insights.
Ability to perform statistical analysis and modelling.
Proficiency in leveraging Statistical techniques in analysis.
Experience with Descriptive statistics like - hypothesis testing, Correlation analysis etc. 
Experience with Predictive Modelling (Linear / Logistic Regression) and Time Series Forecasting
Experience with analytics platforms such as MicroStrategy, Tableau, Power BI.
Databricks experience preferred.
Other Skills (Good To Have)

Knowledge of Predictive analytics techniques.
Knowledge of Azure cloud data environments.
Prior experience / exposure to applying analytics in a Supply Chain environment will be a plus.
Comfortable with complexity and ambiguity.

Title: Consultant, Data Analytics
Company: Northern Trust · Pune, Maharashtra, India · 2 weeks ago
Experience Level:
On-site
Matches your job preferences, workplace type is On-site.
Full-time
Matches your job preferences, job type is Full-time.
Mid-Senior level
Description:
About the job
About Northern Trust

Northern Trust, a Fortune 500 company, is a globally recognized, award-winning financial institution that has been in continuous operation since 1889.

Northern Trust is proud to provide innovative financial services and guidance to the world’s most successful individuals, families, and institutions by remaining true to our enduring principles of service, expertise, and integrity. With more than 130 years of financial experience and over 22,000 partners, we serve the world’s most sophisticated clients using leading technology and exceptional service.

Summary

The NT IT Metrics & Analytics (ITMA) team delivers business intelligence and predictive analytics across the NT IT and corporate data landscape. This service enables simplified access across commonly needed datasets across the IT organization and beyond. A relatively new practice at NT, ITMA begins its 3rd year in 2022. The team works in an Agile fashion to deliver value to our clients quickly and incrementally. In addition to evolving our current production products, ITMA has a healthy backlog new work/demand for its reporting or its data. IT Metrics & Analytics seeks an experienced, data focused, full stack developer to add to its flexible and high performing agile development team. This role will work closely with the ITMA lead architect to support the existing ITMA data platform and enable its evolution over time.

The NT Strategy + IT Strategy will always guide ITMA to provide visibility into the right information for IT Leadership and other internal NT clients to deliver on their plans.

Responsibilities

The new ITMA Associate Consultant, Data Analytics will:

 Foster a collaborative and high performing team
 Rapidly and effectively adapt to highly dynamic and fast-paced work environment
 Develop expertise in the IT and corporate data landscape including plans for change in underlying operational systems
 Support the current ITMA databases (MS SQLServer) and data platform (Incorta) and evolution required to enable new ITMA reporting and analytics data sources and products
 Pursue relentless automation to reduce unnecessary and error prone practices with analytics on common datasets
 Ensure all ITMA implementations adhere to all relevant NT IT Risk and Control Standards ensuring all cybersecurity and other risks are properly managed.
 Research and advise on technical options regarding decisions related to data platform and/or BI Tool decisions
 Carries out complex initiatives involving multiple disciplines and/or ambiguous issues
 Displays a balanced, cross-functional perspective, liaising with the business to improve efficiency, effectiveness and productivity
 Assist internal customers with acceptance and adoption of implemented solutions to transition to an operating model that will deliver value from the analytics solution
 Provide support, as needed, on existing reporting and analytics production products
 Participate in special projects as needed and perform other duties as assigned

Skills & Experience

 4+ years of building and supporting full stack technology solutions with a focus on data
 Good working Knowledge in database products, SQL and all associated tooling
 Good working knowledge on any visualization tool , preferably Power BI
 Curious, highly flexible and adaptable to change
 Team player and supportive of developing skills of others
 Strong financial acumen and ability to work across the business
 Bachelor’s Degree in a related field and/or equivalent work experience required
 Excellent oral and written communication skills are required
 Seasoned multi-disciplinary expert with technical and business knowledge and functional expertise

Working With Us

As a Northern Trust partner, greater achievements await. You will be part of a flexible and collaborative work culture in an organization where financial strength and stability is an asset that emboldens us to explore new ideas.

Movement within the organization is encouraged, senior leaders are accessible, and you can take pride in working for a company committed to assisting the communities we serve! Join a workplace with a greater purpose.

We’d love to learn more about how your interests and experience could be a fit with one of the world’s most admired and sustainable companies! Build your career with us and apply today. #MadeForGreater

Reasonable accommodation

Northern Trust is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please email our HR Service Center at MyHRHelp@ntrs.com.

We hope you’re excited about the role and the opportunity to work with us. We value an inclusive workplace and understand flexibility means different things to different people.

Apply today and talk to us about your flexible working requirements and together we can achieve greater.

About the job
Job Description

Key responsibilities:

Data collection and Management
Gather and compile data related to sustainable metrics from various sources with heavy focus on supply chain / due diligence such as energy consumption, waste generation, carbon emissions, supply chain practices and social impact indicators 
Organize and maintain database to ensure accurate and up to date data for regular repots / at hoc reports 
Managing the transformation from manual data management to digitalization 
Data Analysis:
Use statistical analysis and data visualization tools to identify trends, patterns and insights 
Assess and interpret data to evaluation NX supply chain sustainability, sustainability related risks and alignment with goals 
Reporting and Communication
Prepare reports, dashboards, and presentations to communicated sustainability performance to internal stakeholders, executives, and external partners 
Collaboration with cross functional teams to develop recommendations and action plans on data analysis 
Compliance and regulatory support
Stay up to date with relevant sustainability regulatory, standards and reporting requirements 
Assist in ensuring organization compliance with sustainable related laws and regulations 
Performance monitoring
Monitor the progress of sustainability initiatives and track key performance indicators to measure impact of Sustainability Efforts over the time 
Identity areas for improvement and propose data driven solutions 
Data Strategy support
Support Supply chain Sustainability data strategy short term as well as long term 
Data quality assurance
Implement data quality controls and validation process to maintain the accuracy and reliability of data 
Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree / Master preferred in relevant field such as environmental science, sustainability, data science, statistics, or relevant discipline 
Strong analytical skills, including proficiency in data analysis software (?), and data visualization tools 
Decent understanding about GHG inventory and Scope 1 2 and 3 data management, familiar with emission calculations 
Work experience with at least 5 years, manufacturing environmental preferred 
Knowledge about sustainability frameworks and reporting standards such as SBT, GRI, SABS, CDP, ISO 14001 and others 
Understanding of environmental and social sustainability issues and trends 
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, to convey complex data insights to diverse audiences 
Attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy 
Project management skills and the ability to work independently and in cross functional team 
Experience to roll out a data strategy and set up data management system 
Experience in working in a global multi-cultural setting 

Personal Skills

Strong commitment to ethical and responsible business practices
Out of the box thinker and curiosity 
Leadership and conflict management 
Able to work under pressure and to go beyond 
Hands on
Genuine interest in building processes and systems 

At Nextracker, we are leading in the energy transition, providing the most comprehensive portfolio of intelligent solar tracker and software solutions for solar power plants, as well as strategic services to capture the full value of solar power plants for our customers. Our talented worldwide teams are transforming PV plant performance every day with smart technology, data monitoring and analysis services.

For us at Nextracker, sustainability is not just a word. It's a core part of our business, values and our operations. Our sustainability efforts are based on five cornerstones: People, Community, Environment, Innovation, and Integrity. We are creative, collaborative and passionate problem-solvers from diverse backgrounds, driven by our shared mission to provide smart solar and software solutions for our customers and to mitigate climate change for future generations.

Culture is our Passion

Title: Data Analyst II
Company: Microsoft · Hyderabad, Telangana, India · 1 week ago
Experience Level:
Full-time
Matches your job preferences, job type is Full-time.
Description:
About the job
Do you have a relentless passion for data and analytics and a desire to drive future products via key data insights? Do you want to help shape the future of collaboration experience and personal computing, by helping direct where investments should happen? Does the thought of being able to influence the product in each stage of the lifecycle through insights & predictions excite you? Do you love measuring, understanding, and predicting based on real-world user data to come up with insights that drive experiments and recommendations to help move business metrics? If so, we want to talk to you!

We are the Data & Applied Sciences team for Windows at Hyderabad, India. We work across various Windows products with the goal of using advanced analytics & data science to inform decision making, drive product performance and maximize business impact through the power of ML/AI. In short, we thrive on data to solve high impact business problems for Windows!

We're looking for an enthusiastic and expert Data and Applied Scientist (DAS) to help us build and deliver business Intelligence through data for experiences running on the next generation of Windows devices. Your responsibilities will include working closely with a variety of teams such as program management, development, design, hardware and application partners to understand the key business questions for customer-facing scenarios, to set up the key performance indicators, deeply analyze the data to identify insights and experiment ideas that moves our business metrics. We will be looking to you to help evaluate the return of investments on new ideas, to assess if investments are meeting customer and business promises, to design and assess experiments, to measure growth and to derive insights that help identify next wave of opportunities and problems to be solved.

Responsibilities

As a Data Analyst, you will specialize in owning and analyzing the business questions for the team. Through your analysis and research, you will curate and maintain Key Performance Indicators which show trends towards achieving a business goal. You will learn and excel ways to find patterns in the data that are harder to find but can lead to getting to our business objectives. Your analysis will not only show us what we’re doing right or wrong in our current methodology, but also what customer segment and strategies we should invest more in, and how, for achieving and exceeding our goals.

Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Analytics, Data Science, Engineering, Computer Science, Business, Economics or related field\
OR Associate's Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Analytics, Data Science, Engineering, Computer Science, Business, Economics or related field
OR equivalent experience. If this sounds like you, contact us now and we’d love to talk to you! Join us to move Windows forward!
Experience of SQL and common database.
Ability to process and run quick data analysis using python.
Ability to perform Statistical analysis on datasets and come up with insights.
Experience of evaluation of experimentation in the real world with various performance metrics.
Experience of causal analysis is a plus.
Other expected skills:
Algorithm Development
 Analytical Skills
 Data Cleaning
 Data Evangelism
 Data Integration
 Data Integrity
 Data Mining
 Data Visualization
 Database Querying
 Dependency Management
 Detail Oriented
 English Language Proficiency
 Oral Communication
 Problem Solving
 Research
 Statistics
 Technical Communication
 Technical Expertise

Full-time

Mid-Senior level
Description:
About the job
AVEVA is a global leader in industrial software. Our cutting-edge solutions are used by thousands of enterprises to deliver the essentials of life – such as energy, infrastructure, chemicals and minerals – safely, efficiently and more sustainably.

We’re the first software business in the world to have our sustainability targets validated by the SBTi, and we’ve been recognized for the transparency and ambition of our commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion. We’ve also recently been named as one of the world’s most innovative companies.

If you’re a curious and collaborative person who wants to make a big impact through technology, then we want to hear from you! Find out more at https://www.aveva.com/en/about/careers/

Benefits : 

We require this role to meet existing demand to handle numerous data from various business users or stakeholders.

Role Summary: 

AVEVA is seeking a Senior Data and BI Analyst to join enterprise data and analytics team. The Senior Analyst will be instrumental in driving data-driven decision-making processes within AVEVA. This role entails extracting, analyzing, and interpreting complex data sets to provide actionable insights aligned with AVEVA's business objectives. Additionally, the Senior Analyst will be responsible for developing and maintaining robust BI solutions to facilitate data visualization and reporting for stakeholders across AVEVA's diverse business units.

Key Responsibilities

 Lead the design, development, and implementation of BI solutions tailored to meet AVEVA's unique business requirements.
 Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and translate them into technical specifications.
 Execute data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes from various sources to populate AVEVA's data factory and data marts.
 Develop and maintain data models, dashboards, and reports utilizing BI tools such as Power BI or similar platforms.
 Conduct in-depth data analysis to uncover trends, patterns, and insights crucial for informing strategic decisions within AVEVA.
 Perform data profiling, ad-hoc analysis and data mining to support specific business inquiries and initiatives.
 Ensure data accuracy, completeness, and integrity through ongoing data quality assessments and validation processes.
 Provide technical expertise and guidance to junior analysts and business users within AVEVA on BI tools and data best practices.
 Stay updated with industry trends and emerging technologies in data management and analytics.

Essential Experience

8/10 years of experience in Data profiling, data analysis, SQL Query, Data warehouse, reporting concepts.

Desirable Experience: 10 years of experience in IT Data and BI Analyst role.

AVEVA requires all successful applicants to undergo and pass a comprehensive background check before they start employment. Background checks will be conducted in accordance with local laws and may, subject to those laws, include proof of educational attainment, employment history verification, proof of work authorization, criminal records, identity verification, credit check. Certain positions dealing with sensitive and/or third party personal data may involve additional background check criteria.

AVEVA is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to being an exemplary employer with an inclusive culture, developing a workplace environment where all our employees are treated with dignity and respect. We value diversity and the expertise that people from different backgrounds bring to our business.

Come and join AVEVA to create the transformative technology that enables our customers to engineer a better world.

About the job
Every career journey is personal. That's why we empower you with the tools and support to create your own success story. 

Be challenged. Be heard. Be valued. Be you ... be here.

Job Summary

This position works with the Digital Products & Capabilities teams to support definition, development, commercialization, and management of new and existing products and capabilities via expertise and execution of digital, behavioral, and performance analytics. This position supports the development of reporting to track against digital KPIs; conducts research, executes digital tracking requirements, builds expertise in both site and cross-channel analytics, and prepares and delivers presentations to key internal stakeholders.

Job Description

Essential Job Functions

Digital Analytics Strategy: Defines analytics standards for digital capabilities as part of the business requirements process. Collaborates with Capability Owners to understand and influence the overarching strategy for assigned capabilities and aides in the development of digital measurement plans.
Digital Analytics Management & Analysis: Manages standards for digital analytics reporting, creates and publishes KPI dashboards along with guides on how to interpret data. Maintains detailed documentation on new and existing digital data assets. Collaborates with Capability Managers, Owners, IT, Business Analysts, and the rest of the Digital Analytics team to prioritize the approved work list. 
Develops detailed analytics (business & technology) requirements, feature definitions and implementation plans for digital products and capabilities. With a data driven mindset, influences the development of the user experience for digital products and capabilities, including feature/functionality, interface design, and UX. Provides support in solving business problems and/or escalated production support issues. 
Supports or refutes hypothesis via data extracts and analysis, providing data driven insights on business value of assigned capabilities and proposed digital enhancements.
Analytics Innovation: Conducts market research and analysis of Digital Analytics features and technologies, participates in the creation of business cases and presentations for key internal stakeholders, participates in the product development process, and performs business testing during technical implementations.


Reports to: Lead or above

Working Conditions/ Physical Requirements: Normal working conditions in an office environment

Direct Reports: N/A

Degree Required: Bachelor’s Degree
Area of Study: Analytics, Decision Science, Mathematics
Years of Work Experience Required: Two or more years
Type / focus of work experience required: Digital analytics reporting tools (Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics), experience with SQL or other database query languages, strong understanding of the Internet, online shopping, web design/layout and navigation, advanced excel skills


Preferred Experience

Years of Work Experience Preferred: Three years or more
Type / focus of work experience preferred: Digital analytics, Marketing analytics, Retail and/or ecommerce

Because job content may change from time to time, the Company reserves the right to add and/or delete essential functions from this job at any time.

About Bread Financial

At Bread Financial, you’ll have the opportunity to grow your career, give back to your community, and be part of our award-winning culture. We’ve been consistently recognized as a best place to work nationally and in many markets and we’re proud to promote an environment where you feel appreciated, accepted, valued, and fulfilled—both personally and professionally. Bread Financial supports the overall wellness of our associates with a diverse suite of benefits and offers boundless opportunities for career development and non-traditional career progression.

Bread FinancialTM is a tech-forward financial services company providing simple, personalized payment, lending and saving solutions. The company creates opportunities for its customers and partners through digitally enabled choices that offer ease, empowerment, financial flexibility and exceptional customer experiences. Driven by a digital-first approach, data insights and white-label technology, Bread Financial delivers growth for its partners through a comprehensive suite of payment solutions that includes private label and co-brand credit cards and Bread Pay™ buy now, pay later products. Bread Financial also offers direct-to-consumer products that give customers more access, choice and freedom through its branded Bread CashbackTM American Express® Credit Card and Bread SavingsTM products.

Headquartered in Columbus, Ohio, Bread Financial is powered by its approximately 7,000 global associates and is committed to sustainable business practices.

Title: Lead Data Analyst
Company: Hinge Health · Bengaluru, Karnataka, India · Reposted 1 month ago
Experience Level:
Hybrid
Matches your job preferences, workplace type is Hybrid.
Full-time
Matches your job preferences, job type is Full-time.
Mid-Senior level
Description:
About the job
Hinge Health is moving people beyond pain by transforming the way it is treated and prevented. Connecting people digitally and in-person with expert clinical care, we combine advanced technology, AI and a care team of experts to guide people through personalized care directly from their phone. Our approach is proven to reduce pain by 68%, prevent 42% of new opioid prescriptions, and avoid more than half of joint replacement surgeries. Available to 18M people, Hinge Health is trusted by leading health plans and employers, including Land O’Lakes, L.L. Bean, Salesforce, Self-Insured Schools of California, Southern Company, State of New Jersey, US Foods, and Verizon.

Learn more at http://www.hingehealth.com

Hinge Health Hybrid Model

We believe that remote work and in-person work have their own advantages and disadvantages, and we want to be able to leverage the best of both worlds. Employees in hybrid roles are required to be in the office 3 days/week.

About The Role

Operations at Hinge Health spans clinicians (physical therapists, health coaches, NPs, MDs), support teams, workforce management and business operations. As part of the operations analytics team, you’ll be working cross-functionally on projects ranging from discovering the right combination of clinical interventions balancing member needs and preferences, advancing the sophistication of our clinician performance management and influencing process redesign with root cause analyses. You will be a highly-visible, trusted partner for our operations leaders working on problems that haven’t been solved before at this scale in the digital health space.

The ideal candidate has 4-6 years of experience in data analytics or business analytics working with business/ operational stakeholders. They have strong technical skills with the ability to write their own queries in SQL and run basic data manipulation and analyses using SQL. The candidate should also have a ability to quickly get up to speed on new business models and communicate clearly data-driven insights that will impact the business. The ideal candidate also knows how to go deep into data, extract insights and develop compelling data visualizations in Tableau.

What You’ll Accomplish

Conduct root cause analyses and deep dives to determine the underlying drivers of member behaviors, clinical outcomes and landed costs 
Develop an operational mindset and drive analytics initiatives optimizing across member experience, clinical outcomes and business metrics 
Challenge prevailing assumptions and help leaders understand the key drivers of the issues
Work across functions, incorporate the right data sources and ensure the teams have visibility over the right KPIs

What We're Looking For

Strong ability to grasp business concepts and communicate data-driven business insights
Experience in analytics with a focus on operational reporting (KPIs) and cross-functional analysis
Strong data visualization and communication skills with the ability to synthesize and tailor complex insights to the leaders
SQL, Python experience required
Prior experience with Tableau a must
A high attention to detail and the ability to QA data at a glance or in depth
Ability to work autonomously and with minimal guidance

BONUS POINTS 

Experience with scheduling optimization and/or medical record systems
Experience with people performance analytics

About Hinge Health

LinkedIn recently named Hinge Health one of the Top 50 Startups. Forbes, Fast Company, and Inc. have also recognized our technology, innovation, and culture.

Since our founding in 2014, we've raised more than $800 million from leading investors, including Coatue and Tiger Global. We work with 1000 customers across every industry and the public sector — including Salesforce, Verizon, and the State of New Jersey — to give more than 23 million people access to the care they need. We’re positioned to continue leading the market with unmatched investments in clinical research, care innovation, machine learning, AI, and computer vision.

Diversity And Inclusion

We’re committed to building diverse teams that reflect the communities we serve. Visit hingehealth.com/diversity-equity-and-inclusion to learn more about what moves us.

Hinge Health is an equal opportunity employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. We make employment decisions without regards to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, veteran status, disability status, pregnancy, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

We provide reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities. If you feel you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, let us know by reaching out to your recruiter.

By providing your information through this page or applying for a job at Hinge Health, you acknowledge that Hinge Health will collect, use, and process your information as part of our job application process. For more information on how Hinge Health processes your personal information, click here to view our Applicant and Personnel Privacy Notice.

Disclaimer

There continues to be a significant increase in phishing attempts across all industries where fraudsters are impersonating real employees and sending fictitious job offers to applicants in a scheme to obtain sensitive information. Please note that we will never ask for your financial information at any part of the interview process including the post-offer stage, and will only correspond through @hingehealth.com domain email addresses.

If you encounter any suspicious activity, we recommend you cease all communication with the individual and consider reporting them to the U.S. FBI Internet Crime Complaint Center. If you would like to verify the legitimacy of an email you received from our recruiting team, please forward it to security@hingehealth.com

*Please do not send resumes via email*

Description:
About the job
Job Description

The Data Solution Consultant is responsible for the daily efforts to provide a great customer and employee

experience by effectively delivering real-time (intra-day) management with the purpose of optimizing resources to

achieve business objectives. Key functional responsibility includes the ability to demonstrate a strong understanding

of how planning/forecasting staffing requirements translate to the creation of optimal schedules and real-time (intra-

day) management to support multi-department operations. The ability to create forecasting and scheduling to that

forecast is crucial.

Inherent Characteristics

 Customer Focus: Must demonstrate competency in dealing with all levels of employees /management and

building strong relationships with teams, customers, and all departments.

 Functional/Technical Skills: Must possess strong quantitative, analytical, and technical aptitude skills

 Drive for Results: Must possess the ability to work under pressure, meet deadlines and be accountable for

performance.

 Time Management: Must be able to multi-task, be detail oriented and demonstrate strong organizational

skills.

 Interpersonal Savvy: Must demonstrate excellent interpersonal skills with all levels of organizational team

members.

 Written Communication: Must possess the ability to effectively, accurately, and concisely convey thoughts

and concepts, and provide information to all management leaders.

 Problem Solving: Must demonstrate the proactive ability to find and define problems, understand business

impact, identify solutions and provide recommendations for corrective action.

 Decision Quality: Must possess the ability to work independently, establish priorities and demonstrate good

judgment skills.

 Learning on the Fly: Must be willing and able to take the initiative for learning, increasing knowledge, and

improving skills in a self-directed manner to improve performance and position added value.

 Dealing with Ambiguity: Ability to adapt and excel as a team player in a fast-paced and change-oriented

environment.

Key Responsibilities

 Provide real-time monitoring via available tools (SQL, Google Data Studio, Advance Excel, and Google

Sheet) and workforce management techniques to make intra-day adjustments in an effort to maximize

resource efficiency and achieve service level goals/business objectives.

 Perform continual analysis of current performance (noting recent historical trends) and conduct real-time re-

forecasting to make necessary adjustments in staffing plans and coordinate with Operations teams to

achieve service level goals/business objectives for a multi-site operation.

 Design and develop the dashboard with google data studio and google Sheets.

 Maintain constant communication with Operations teams to coordinate needed staffing adjustments based

on current and forecasted results.

 Produces performance forecasts on a daily, weekly, monthly, and annual basis for multi-site operation for

the given project

 Generates and evaluates staffing schedules, and ensures data updates in the scheduling system.

Generates short and long-term staffing models and provides recommendations based on analysis.

 Compares results to forecast and identify opportunities for improvement.

 Provide daily/intra-day performance reports to leadership with key insights of each prospect

 Must possess strong communication skills to ensure that department/Stake owners are kept informed of

developments effectively, and to ensure that all are aware of issues

 Other related duties as assigned.

Experience

 Must have a good working knowledge of Excel, Advance Excel, and other Windows-based programs (Word,

PowerPoint, etc.), and have the ability to organize/analyze data in a structured manner.

 Must possess analytical skills essentially for reviewing information, analyzing data, and making appropriate

recommendations for improvement with key business insights.

 Capacity Planning Experience Is Preferred.

 Proficient with SQL, Google Data Studio, Advance Excel, and Google Sheets.

 Design and manage databases and data flows to ensure smooth business operations

 Examine data, processes, and technologies to evaluate the current state and critical problems for both

internal business functions and external client projects

 Experience in dashboarding using google data studio and google sheet to manage schedules, workflow, and

statistical data

 Knowledge of programming languages like python will be added advantage for data science.

 Minimum of 4+ years of relevant experience in performing Business/Data/Product Analyst/ WFM functions &

Forecasting (specifically real-time management) in a multi-department/project required.

 Bachelor’s degree in Computer
